Senior Technical Program Manager
IT, InfoSec, Cyber Risk & Business Operations | San Francisco, California

This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia, and Wyoming.

Our agreement with employees
DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what's right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you'll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.

The team
Our IT, InfoSec, Cyber Risk & Business Ops team - is in the business of trust and reliability. We create, maintain, and operate scalable technology and data solutions that deliver an exceptional experience for our internal & external customers. We embrace Agile principles and values, favor DevOps practices, and view infrastructure as code, all while we create an infrastructure that scales and supports our growth and ambitious vision. This requires a smart, highly collaborative team who can identify, investigate, and implement new technologies to continue securely scaling our global business.

This position

The Senior Technical Program Manager will drive the timely delivery of systems and enterprise projects to support key strategic initiatives in the Digital Technology Services organization. This position requires a highly driven individual with demonstrated experience in delivering projects in fast paced technical environments. The successful candidate will have proven ability to drive consensus and provide direction to multiple cross-functional stakeholders while maintaining efficient plans, tracking issues, and proactively communicating project status.

This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Director, Technology Program Management and is designated Flex.

Responsibilities

Create and manage all project management artifacts including project plan, issues & risks log, budgets, and status updates
Prioritize and balance between competing priorities to deliver outcomes on-time and on-budget
Run meetings and set agendas effectively, and track performance against agreed upon commitments
Communicate with business stakeholders and team members. Set and continually manage project expectations with team members and partners on an ongoing basis
Prepare and deliver presentations to facilitate alignment, and develop a shared understanding of the impacts, benefits, and changes to expect
Drive collaboration with project sponsor/s to plan project objectives, scope and deliverables
Develop and communicate project status, KPI's and project documentation to stakeholders, sponsor/s and executives
Manage vendor relationships and review scope of work in agreements
Collaborate with Project Management and Change Enablement professionals across DocuSign sharing leading practices and evolve our methodology

Basic qualifications

Strong experience in technology enterprise applications implementation, planning, execution, and delivery
Oracle Financials (PO, AP, AR GL, etc.), Oracle Supplier Management implementation experience
8+ years of combined Technical Program Management with a proven track record of delivery
5+ years of experience of project management best practices and Agile methodology
3+ years of experience in JIRA and Confluence with demonstrated capability using JIRA and Confluence to manage Agile scrum teams
Experience with business applications and Agile software development methodologies and productivity tools, including Jira, Confluence, ServiceNow, Smartsheet, G-Suite etc.
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience

Preferred qualifications

Ability to quickly understand complex issues and develop/apply simplifying frameworks to facilitate broader organizational understanding, decision-making and action
Detail-oriented with excellent verbal, written, organizational, presentation and interpersonal communications skills
Ability to present and explain complex information in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others and gains understanding
Adept at building close working relationships and quickly establishing personal credibility across an organization, maintaining a high level of professionalism, self-motivation, and a strong sense of urgency

Vaccination requirement (US)
DocuSign requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Therefore, to ensure the safety and well being of our employees and community, to support public health efforts, and comply with the Executive Order that applies to federal contractors, this offer is conditioned upon submission of written proof, prior to your start date, that you are fully vaccinated. DocuSign will comply with applicable law regarding the reasonable accommodation of individuals with disabilities and/or sincerely held religious beliefs.

About us
DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, over a million customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. And we help save the world's forests and embrace environmental sustainability.

It's important to us that we build a talented team that is as diverse as our customers and where all employees feel a deep sense of belonging and thrive. We encourage great talent who bring a range of perspectives to apply for our open positions. DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes hiring decisions based on experience, skill, aptitude and a can-do approach. We will not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected category.

Accommodations
DocuSign provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures, including if you have any difficulty using our online system. If you need such an accommodation, you may contact us at accommodations@docusign.com.

Rakuten Advertising, headquartered in San Mateo, California provides digital marketing and advertising services with rich consumer insights that help brands reach new customers and sustain loyalty. Media solutions is an important part of the portfolio, and we are looking for a strong Engineering Leader that is innovative and has great experience in product development, quality assurance, and DevOps. Experience in engineering in an RTB environment is an advantage. This role reports to the CTO of Rakuten Advertising.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead local and remote software engineering teams

Co-manage team strategy and OKRs with Product and Product Design counterparts, while driving success against the strategy and OKRs

Be a leader in technology trends and evolving social behavior of the engineering team under you to support the successful build and delivery of world-class software

Manage and foster individual and team growth of your local and remote teams

Establish standards of performance and monitor the performance of technology systems that the team owns.

Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, accountability, and operational excellence

Lead agile planning processes to achieve engineering goals by identifying and prioritizing development agile stories and setting timetables for the evaluation, development, and deployment of technology builds

Recruit, hire, and manage the performance of your staff, including personal improvement, mentorship, performance reviews

Measurably improve both discovery and delivery efficiency for product development teams

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS (Knowledge, Skills, Abilities)

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
10+ years of Software Engineering experience building large scale service-backed consumer-facing web and mobile SSP / RTB solutions

7+ years in a leadership role including managing Engineering leaders/managers

Successfully transitioned organizations to modern Engineering processes and tools

Demonstrated experience using real-world data and analytics to drive both product and team improvements and success

Deep understanding of mobile app and web app ecosystems and technology

Demonstrated ability to plan, organize and execute strategic initiatives to advance and drive product direction and vision

Proven track record for hiring, retaining, and developing talent

Strong ability to communicate, motivate and energize across the entire product development organization

Thorough understanding of various development methodologies to drive overall communication, efficiency, and quality

Natural desire to continuously improve

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent experience

Broad knowledge of industry and trends in Media, Programmatic and eCommerce

Experience with both startups and established companies

Experience driving security and privacy best practices

Experience in a B2B2C business

RAKUTEN SHUGI PRINCIPLES

Our worldwide practices describe specific behaviors that make Rakuten unique and united across the world. We expect Rakuten employees to model these 5 Shugi Principles of Success.

Always improve, always advance. Only be satisfied with complete success - Kaizen

Be passionately professional. Take an uncompromising approach to your work and be determined to be the best

Hypothesize - Practice - Validate - Shikumika. Use the Rakuten Cycle to succeed in unknown territory

Maximize Customer Satisfaction. The greatest satisfaction for workers in a service industry is to see their customers smile

Speed!! Speed!! Speed!! Always be conscious of time. Take charge, set clear goals, and engage your team

#LI-AT1

Company Description
As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.
At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.
You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.

Job Description
About Global Commercial Payments Platform – B2B Connect
We are working on multiple technology stacks and want to add a highly motivated Engineer to our Commercial Payments organization in Foster City, CA. Visa's Commercial Payments organization is responsible for managing Visa's B2B Payment Global adoption on Cross-Border funds movement, innovation agenda and the management of strategic partnerships with critical financial institutions. This group is responsible for defining and building the Non-Card based payment innovation and product for Visa Inc. Globally. This includes:
Distributed-Ledger based Cross border payment platform
Near time Settlement
Enterprise ID stamping to create a digital identity for corporate entities
Hyperledger chain-code development
End-to-End Payment eco-system
Analytics and Data visualization
You can learn more about our work here:
Visa B2B Connect Launches Globally
Essential Functions
Work on emerging technologies, building distributed applications
Collaborate with project team members (Product Managers, Architects, Analysts, Software Engineers, Project Managers, etc.) to ensure development and implementation of new data driven business solutions.
Drive development effort End-to-End for on-time delivery of high quality solutions that conform to requirements, conform to the architectural vision, and comply with all applicable standards.
Collaborate with senior technical staff and PM to identify, document, plan contingency, track and manage risks and issues until all are resolved
Present technical solutions, capabilities, considerations, and features in business terms. Effectively communicate status, issues, and risks in a precise and timely manner.
Partner with Product on implementation strategy.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

10 years of work experience with a Bachelor's Degree in a related field or at least 8 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree or at least 3 years of work experience with a PhD

Preferred Qualifications:
12 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or 8-10 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 6+ years of work experience with a PhD

BS in Computer Science10+ years of experience with distributed software developmentHands-on experience with all aspects of software development: data, server-side, UI, and open-source softwareExperience in handling large data volume and having strong knowledge in Data wrangling and data pipeline is must haveExperience with Linux, Open source, C++ or Java, client-server appsExpertise in at least two of the following: Java / Go / Scala / Python,Familiar with container strategies and ecosystems such as Docker, KubernetesKnowledge of cloud architecture and scalable solutions including orchestration
BlockChain technical expertise is a plus

Travel Requirements: This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.
Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.

What we are building
Have you ever wondered if there was a way to predict if a new release is going to break a critical user journey? Are you feeling frustrated that regardless of how much testing is done before a release, you can’t seem to detect the issues that impact the Customer Experience before your users do?
If so, RelicX is the breakthrough solution you may be looking for. It uses AI/ML to continuously learn user behavioral patterns from live user interactions, automatically generates tests to validates user flow actions in the CI/CD pipeline, and scores the application release readiness based on the predicted CX-impact.
About Us
RelicX is co-founded by Sushil Kumar (CEO) and Gurashish Brar (CTO) who have several years of industry experience building and selling DevOps solutions at large companies like Oracle and Microsoft. Sushil ran a $200M DevOps business at CA Technologies/Broadcom as the General Manager, managing a team of 300+ spanning engineering, product management, marketing, and sales. Gurashish is an IIT/GeorgiaTech alumni who previously worked at Microsoft and BloomReach, and co-founded and sold his previous startup (Opas.ai) to Rubrik.
We are backed by Unusual Ventures and industry legends such as Jyoti Bansal (AppDynamics founder), John Vrionis (Lead investor in AppDynamics, Nicira, and Nimble Storage), and Ajeet Singh (ThoughtSpot founder CEO, Nutanix co-founder).
Location

As a born-in-pandemic company, we operate a fully remote team with office locations in the San Francisco Bay Area and Bengaluru, India.
What You Will Do
Join a Rockstar engineering team: You will be joining an all-star engineering team comprising Stanford-ians, Berkelites, and IITians, drawn from marquee companies such as Google, Microsoft, Rubrik, and Rippling.
Architect and build product: You will own the end-to-end development of a key part of our product. You will work closely with our founding team and customer design partners to shape and define what we build.
Define and shape culture: As a founding member, you’ll have the opportunity to define our engineering culture. A company is only as amazing as the set of people who comprise it - so you’ll help set the foundation for the next 10yrs of RelicX.
About Role
You will be building a large-scale real-time data ingestion framework, with streaming analytics of User activity tracked across multiple customers, highly visible consumer or business applications.
You will work with Data Scientist / ML engineers to perform sophisticated behavior analytics based on the incoming user session stream at a very large scale, as well as storing data into a scalable backend with fast analytics. You will be responsible for running multiple streaming pipelines performing data transformation, analysis, summarization.
You will be leveraging the cutting edge cloud technologies to build low maintenance and auto scaling and robust systems
About you
You should have 3-5 years of experience, preferably in a startup, or high growth and fast-paced enterprise
Prior experience in building SaaS products will be a big plus. So, will a master degree in computer science.
Expertise in Typescript and Python programming, Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS.
Prior exposure to building highly scalable, data-driven applications will be a big plus
Comfortable working in a globally distributed, fully remote, and diverse team
Benefits
Seed/Founding Stage Equity
Health, Vision and Dental
401K
Generous PTO/Sick Leave

CoderPad's mission is to improve the technical interviewing experience with tools that allow for standardization and consistency, in the name of reducing bias and increasing equality of opportunity.
What does a Software Engineer at CoderPad do?
As a Full Stack Engineer, you'll join a team focused on initiatives that position CoderPad as the best tool for interviewing and assessing technical talent. Developers love us!
Your work will impact the user experience of candidates and interviewers and pave the way in improving the technical hiring process – reducing bias for the next generation of engineers. You'll tie your work to metrics that drive CoderPad’s business and individual feature usage that propels our product-led growth motion. We collaborate with Product Managers, Designers, User Researchers, and other engineers to define project plans and solve the most impactful problems to delight CoderPad's customers.
Do you have an iterative mindset, a passion for building simple tools that solve real problems, and a love for tackling big challenges? If so, we can’t wait to meet you! Your manager will be the VP of Engineering.
Key Sample Projects
Improving the way specific engineering roles are assessed on CoderPad, by allowing candidates to showcase their skills in an environment that resembles their day-to-day work
Adding new tools for hiring managers to create consistent and fair interview processes that reduce bias
Iterating on Drawing Mode to enable easier creation of architectural and systems diagrams
Updating built-in package offerings for our 30+ supported languages
Launching, monitoring, and maintaining experiments and feature rollouts
Successful Experience
2-6+ years of professional programming experience with at least 1 year working full stack (just let us know if you want to focus on one side)
Proficiency with Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, React, HTML, CSS, and related web technologies
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced start-up environment, making pragmatic architectural choices and maintaining high engineering standards
Knowledge of cross-browser compatibility issues and client-side performance considerations
Responsible for understanding business requirements and owning a feature
Familiarity with GraphQL and Typescript, and interested in other tech we use, e.g. JSS, NodeJS, Docker, Ansible
CoderPad is a fully remote company, so employees can work from anywhere in the U.S. Therefore, qualified candidates must reside in the United States and be able to work as full-time employees in the U.S. without current or future visa sponsorship. (TN visas are considered on a case by case basis.)
Thinking about applying? Read this from the CEO: https://coderpad.io/blog/thinking-about-joining-coderpad!
Company Overview
CoderPad is on a mission to fix the technical interview process. We serve over 3,300 customers and have hosted more than 3 million technical interviews in 30+ programming languages since our launch in 2013.

Through simplicity, speed and accuracy, CoderPad has become a leading interview platform for hiring teams that need a reliable solution to identify better technical candidates – more fairly! It works like an IDE to emulate real-world scenarios and is easily personalized to specific team needs, ensuring a positive experience for the candidate and interviewer alike. That’s why top companies around the world, like Netflix, Slack and Snowflake, rely on CoderPad to help them prioritize quality talent and scale their hiring efforts.
Benefits for You
We are a small, geographically distributed team. We value the contribution of every team member – personally and professionally. If you enjoy working with a diverse group that feels like a family, we are interested in hearing from you.
Meaningful work with high impact for a well-loved productCompetitive, market-rate salariesStock options with 4-yr vesting scheduleMedical, dental, vision insurance (typically 100% covered for employees)401K with profit sharing ($3,000/yr)Unlimited paid time off (+"Summer Fridays"=every other Friday off)Remote-friendly environment + monthly stipend ($300/mo)Mac computer + in-home work station setup ($400)Parental leave full coverage (primary: 16 wks; secondary: 12 wks)Short-term disability coverage and life insurance policy
Internal mobility and growth opportunitiesDiversity and social good initiativesAnnual company-wide offsite with travel, accommodations & meals covered
And more…
CoderPad is committed to hiring the best talent. All applicants will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, national origin, religion, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran or disability status. Our goal is to be a diverse team that represents a variety of backgrounds and perspectives and a culture where everyone feels included.

DeepSight Technology Inc. of Los Altos, CA is currently hiring for a detail-oriented full-time Imaging Software Developer to join our medical imaging technology team. This full-time position works remotely or at one of our US offices in the St. Louis or San Francisco Bay areas, and earns a competitive salary. We are an established medical imaging technology company and believe that hard work can also be fun.
In addition to excellent pay and our positive work culture, we offer our Imaging Software Developer the following benefits and perks:
Health, vision, and dental coverage
Stock options
401(k)-retirement plan
If we've piqued your interest and you're ready to apply, it's easy! Just fill out our initial mobile-friendly online application. We hope to meet you soon!
OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE
Self-Motivated - sees what needs to get done and takes initiative to do it
Team Player - works well with others and enjoys being a part of a team
Effective Communicator - communicates with clarity and confidence
Analytical - can effectively analyze situations and problem solve in order to find appropriate solutions and/or make adaptations
Optimistic - approaches every situation with positivity and optimism that is contagious
If these ideal traits describe you, please continue reading!
ABOUT DEEPSIGHT TECHNOLOGY INC.
DeepSight Technology Inc. is a stealth mode startup company that has developed breakthrough technology in ultrasound imaging. This new technology will extend both the range and clarity over current systems by 10x - 100x! We are setting new standards that will dramatically improve the capabilities of ultrasound for many years.
In order to develop and improve this technology, we need dedicated team players on our side. Not only do we offer a great team-oriented environment, but we also offer competitive compensation and generous benefits.
IMAGING SOFTWARE DEVELOPER REQUIREMENTS
In this Imaging Software Developer position, we rely on you to effectively develop various signal and image processing algorithms for our advanced ultrasound systems. You work alongside our transducer, hardware, and systems teams to work on optimizing the design of our system prototypes and products. You regularly utilize your knowledge and skillset to help develop the software architecture of our next-generation, high-quality medical imaging systems. Additionally, you utilize Python, C/C++, or CUDA to design our imaging pipeline and implement its components. Your optimistic, team-oriented approach to your role results in productivity and fulfillment as you see your hard work pay off in the future advancements of our medical imaging technology!
Completed Master's in an engineering or computer science field OR equivalent industry experience
At least 5 years of experience in commercial software development
Previous experience with GPU programming (CUDA or OpenCL)
Previous experience with programming environment tools and IDEs such as Visual Studio or Eclipse
Previous experience with UX design and modern UI graphics frameworks, including Qt, WPF, and OpenGL
Programming skills in Python, C++, or CUDA
Top-notch signal and image processing skills
Experience designing software architecture for medical systems and expertise in medical imaging methods like beamforming, Doppler, MRI, or CT would be helpful but are not necessarily required. Are you proud of your hard work and effort? Can you manage multiple tasks without sacrificing quality and accuracy? Is being dependable, professional, and a team player at the heart of all you do? If yes, give us the chance to review your information.
ARE YOU READY?
If you are excited about this Imaging Software Developer opportunity, don't delay. Apply today!
Location: 94024

Company Description
Medable's mission is to get effective therapies to patients faster. We provide an end-to-end, cloud-based platform with a flexible suite of tools that allows patients, healthcare providers, clinical research organizations and pharmaceutical sponsors to work together as a team in clinical trials. Our solutions enable more efficient clinical research, more effective healthcare delivery, and more accurate precision and predictive medicine. Our target audiences are patients, providers, principal investigators, and innovators who work in healthcare and life sciences.
Our vision is to accelerate the path to human discovery and medical cures. We are passionate about driving innovation and empowering consumers. We are proactive, collaborative, self-motivated learners, committed, bold and tenacious. We are dedicated to making this world a healthier place.

Job Description

Lead the Product Management team to create and drive a user experience vision for all Medable products.
Define key performance metrics and ensure cross-team alignment.
Develop, define, and oversee the product’s roadmap and manage it as required for the purpose of meeting deliverables.
Provide direction to the design, product, and research teams from conceptual work through execution.
Help us scale rapidly by reinforcing a design-driven culture that leverages the best product, technology, and innovative talent.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

10+ years experience in full product lifecycle management or a combination of education and experience in this field
5+ years of experience in a leadership role
Bachelor’s degree computer science, computer engineering, business or a related field
MBA preferred
Salesforce, JIRA, Confluence, Prototyping/wireframing tools, G-Suite/MS Office suite experience preferred
Additional Information

Demonstrated experience setting UX vision and innovation
Demonstrated ability to lead a team to execute against, and optimize across, a portfolio of products, projects, and teams simultaneously
Experience working for early-stage and late stage startups preferred
Operational excellence in running high-performing teams
Understanding of key business metrics, data and how it relates to design
Excellent cross-disciplinary collaboration skills and strong organizational agility

JobTitle: Staff/Sr Staff Deep Learning/AI Engineer (Computational Imag...
Content_text:
Position Summary:
This Staff/Sr Staff Deep Learning/AI Engineer in Illumina’s Research group will focus on applying machine learning/deep learning techniques in image processing. They will be a lead in a research team developing machine learning/deep learning methods applied to massive, multimodal genomic and biomedical datasets, with the goal of accelerating the application of genomics and artificial intelligence to improvement of human health.
Responsibilities:
Develop and apply of new algorithms for advanced optical imaging systems.
Develop machine learning(ML)/deep learning(DL) algorithms in various areas of interest, including image enhancement, denoising etc.
Develop and apply signal processing techniques as well as ML/DL algorithms in complex imaging systems.
Mentor and scientifically lead junior members of the team
Build strong collaborative relationships with diverse groups within and outside of Illumina
Listed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.
Requirements:
PhD in computer science, machine learning, data science, computational physics or other relevant areas
5-8+ years of experience in machine learning/deep learning applications in computer vision, image processing
Demonstrated experience with deep learning including TensorFlow, Theano, Torch, with publications of deep learning research in machine learning conferences (NIPS, ICML, ICLR etc) a big plus
Strong software engineering skills in C++ and Python
Strong mathematical background
Strong communication and research presentation skills
3+ years of industry experience of computational imaging, computational photography, and/or digital signal processing preferred
Understanding of genomics and relevant genomics applications is a plus
All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.
Concerns regarding COVID-19 continue as positive cases are experienced in the communities in which we operate. Please be aware that, as a condition of employment, Illumina may require proof of COVID vaccination in accordance with local statutory requirements (subject to limited exceptions) beginning November 1, 2021.
At Illumina, we strive to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace by cultivating an environment in which everyone contributes to our mission. Built on a strong foundation, Illumina has always been rooted in openness, collaboration, and seeking alternative views and perspectives to propel innovation in genomics. We are proud to confirm a zero-net gap in pay, regardless of gender, ethnicity, or race. We also have several Employee Resource Groups (ERG) that deliver career development experiences, increase cultural awareness, and demonstrate our collective commitment to diversity and inclusion in the communities we live and work. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information. If you require accommodation to complete the application or interview process, please contact accommodations@illumina.com.

Welcome to Foresight Mental Health. We're so glad you're considering joining our team.
IT Service Desk Support I


Explore your passion for mental health while being part of an innovative company that's transforming the delivery of mental health care.


In this role, you'll offer first-level support to end users in a fully remote work setting. You'll install, test, monitor, upgrade, maintain and troubleshoot a variety of computer hardware and software systems. You'll also be responsible for creating and maintaining accounts, and assisting staff by investigating issues related to hardware, software and network connectivity.


This is a full-time, remote role.


What you'll do

Work with users and IT teams to prioritize support requests, quickly resolving the most critical issues
Follow all security and compliance requirements as well as maintain inventory of deployed and available systems
Be proficient in operating and troubleshooting Microsoft Windows and MacOS; also, with virus malware prevention, removal and mitigation
Be proficient in SaaS products, help desk software, Okta, RingCentral, Google Workspace, etc.


What you'll bring

Associate's or bachelor's degree (preferred)
Minimum two years of relevant experience, specifically working with Windows and iOS
Availability to work after hours, weekends and holidays as needed


 What you'll receive

Comprehensive medical, dental and vision coverage
Paid time off, sick time, paid holidays
401k with employer match


Come join our dynamic and innovative team working toward mental wellness for all.
Thanks for your interest in working with Foresight

If you are a California resident, please read our California Candidate Privacy Notice here.

Foresight is an equal opportunity employer. We're committed to providing reasonable accommodations and will work with you to meet your needs. JobTitle: newProduct Manager - Enterprise Solutions- Remote Position
CompanyLocation: San Francisco, CA 94103 (South Of Market area)•Remote
Content_text: Skycatch is looking for a Product Manager to help lead our enterprise solutions. This is a special opportunity to help drive the next generation of our product offering and change the way large enterprises work on their job-sites for our global customer base.You’ll be tasked with the strategy and execution of initiatives that are meant to expand our business, market penetration and product use cases.The Product Manager, Enterprise Solutions is situated at the intersection of product management, business development, and strategy. They will help identify, drive and execute on business opportunities that have high strategic value for the company, are aligned with the product roadmap and vision and can be translated into usable and useful products for our customers.*What you'll do: *Devise high-value, cross-platform features that touch both our hardware and software products and take those features from inception to production.Help Identify new solution opportunities via customers and partners engagement sessions.Help drive strategic product integrations that require an excellent understanding of the product, technology, and the market.When required, be able to dive deep into complex technical concepts and translate them back to our customers and team in clear and simple terms.Travel and meet customers, build relationship and listen to customers’ problems and needs to solve their problems via our technology and product.Work with designers on the UX of the entire Skycatch ecosystem and make sure that the “glue” among the products is robust and streamlined.Work with the engineering team to customize our existing products to fit new use cases, verticals, and industries to help expand the business beyond the current target markets.Work with the eng. team to build prototypes and proof of concepts of new products and featuresRun market analyses and research to evaluate and justify potential strategic initiatives in order to get a buy-in from the executive team.Desired Skills and Experience: BS in Engineering or Computer Science or Technical background requiredMBA is a plusProven experience as an engineer2+ years in product management, shipping products to marketExperience in driving programs/projects that require both technical and business capacityExperience in building full stack solutions that include both software and hardwareExperience in working with customers and partners; externally facing experienceGifted at connecting with customers/users, helping them understand their real pain points, and devising creative solutions.Communicate effortlessly with both engineering and business audiencesMotivated by startups; ability to work in a fast-paced, iterative, innovative environment, managing multiple simultaneous effortsMust be excited to travel to work with partners and customersMore about Skycatch: Skycatch (www.skycatch.com) is a platform for capturing data using small autonomous aerial robots. Our product is built for enterprise with safety, strength, and reliability in mind. It can cover large geographic areas, be equipped with different sensors depending on the customer’s needs, and operate in challenging weather conditions. Our proprietary battery-swapping and autonomous landing technology gives our aerial robots the ability to scale and operate without human involvement.Job Type: Full-time

Facebook’s products give people new ways to look after themselves and those they care about. The Health Technologies team supports this mission to discover, develop, and deliver clinically validated health and wellness tools that have the opportunity to improve public health outcomes, at Facebook scale. We are seeking an architect with a background in health technology and low powered devices. As Health Tech architect, you will be working closely with our researchers, algorithm developers, hardware team and data scientist to make sure the full product feature is optimized and technology roadblocks are identified early one. The ideal candidate has strong communication skills, and demonstrated experience in designing and shipping health-related features and systems.


Drive the organization goal towards innovating and building a range of health-related systems
Effectively communicate to leadership teams and the industry partners complex features & systems
Understand industry and Facebook wide technology trends in computing technology to help assess & develop new technologies for health technologies
Suggest, collect and synthesize requirements and create an effective feature roadmap
Invent next generation algorithms to deliver more comfortable and immersive graphics experiences on VR and AR headsets
Adapt standard machine learning and computer vision pipelines to best exploit mobile computing units (e.g. GPU, DSP)


5 or more years of experience with computer vision, machine learning, or image processing
10 or more years of experience with java, python, or c++
Highly experienced leading consumer low powered based projects with industry-wide impact
Highly skilled in one of the areas of on-device machine learning, low powered computer vision or embedded signal processing
Experience building relationships and collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive solutions
Experience in mentoring/influencing senior engineers across organizations


Masters or PhD in algorithm development in a quantitative field such as machine learning, computer science, signal processing, image processing physics, computer vision or numerical computational
Experience in health technologies for low powered devices
Experienced in architecting algorithms from early phase to full launch
Understanding of different mobile processor units and design architecture to optimize an algorithm based on available computing resources


Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. JobTitle: newProduct Manager/ Senior PM; Service Platform
CompanyLocation: San Francisco, CA 94105 (Financial District/South Beach area)+2 locations
Content_text:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
Did you know that over $700 billion is spent each year on integrating systems? Much of that is spent building brittle, single-use, point-to-point connections between systems that become a tangled, insecure, unchangeable mess. Yet the application landscape in most companies is only getting more complex, driven by increasing adoption of best-of-breed SaaS line-of-business solutions and productivity demands requiring specialized software suited to accelerating every task and function.
MuleSoft, a Salesforce company, is delivering the solution to the enormous application management and integration market, enabling agility, reuse and composability on a global scale through API-led connectivity, both on-premises and in the cloud. Our platform is used by organizations in over 60 countries, from emerging companies to Global 500 enterprises including Mastercard, Unilever, Tesla, Intuit, BSkyB and Verizon among others. We are growing rapidly, over 50% year-over-year for a run rate in excess of $600m. Few companies are at this growth and scale so few companies can offer the challenges and growth opportunities you’ll find at Mulesoft. We’re the place to take your career to the next level.
We’re looking for great Senior Product Managers on our Mulesoft services platform team with a passion for driving new products and product capabilities from initial concept to successful delivery and adoption. The services platform product team works on features and foundational capabilities that powers the Anypoint Platform . Within Mulesoft, it has the unique vantage point of serving both internal developer teams and external customers. The ideal candidate will identify compelling market opportunities, and drive a product strategy to maximize the platform network effect. You will function as a primary SME (subject matter expert) on key portions of the product line and the related target markets. You will understand the competitive landscape from strategy to functional capabilities and represent MuleSoft as a domain and product expert in executive councils, strategic customer meetings and major events.
Responsibilities:
Drive the vision, strategy and roadmaps for key portions of the product line
Be a deep expert in the target market, understanding and communicating the competitive landscape and the problems experienced by the target personas
Use your extensive influencing and communication skills to share and align your strategy across the greater PM team and overall product strategy
Maximize our market impact by delivering great solutions with clear positioning and enablement material for our field organizations
Work with your peer engineering leaders to achieve high performance teams that balance innovation, supportability and reliability
Continue to extend vision, strategy, and roadmap
Experience/Skills Required:
3-5 years product management or equivalent experiences working with a technical product
Bachelors (or) Masters degree in Computer Science / Engineering or 3+ years as a Software Engineer or equivalent experiences
Business-driven with a passion for technology - You crave uncovering new revenue opportunities and developing strategies to increase the market presence of your products
Fast learner that can quickly synthesize ideas, information, and options into a strategy, plan, or response and effectively communicate it
Preferred Qualifications:
MBA degree
Understanding of cloud-native technologies such as containerization, Kubernetes, Service Mesh etc. and their ecosystem
Excellent cross-functional collaboration and communication skills across Engineering, Field Sales, and Business Development
Passion for working with developers and IT professionals
Ability to thrive in complex and dynamic organizational environments
Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .
Posting Statement
At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .
Salesforce welcomes all.
Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
As a federal contractor, Salesforce is required to verify that all US-based employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If you receive an offer and are unable to get vaccinated for religious or medical reasons, you may request a reasonable accommodation.

Employee Applicant Privacy Notice

Who we are:

Welcoming, collaborative and having the opportunity to make an impact - is how our employees describe working here. Galileo is a financial technology company that provides innovative and revolutionary software products and services that power some of the world's largest Fintechs. We are the only payments innovator that applies tech and engineering capabilities to empower Fintechs and financial institutions to unleash their full creativity to achieve their most inspired goals. Galileo leads its industry with superior fraud detection, security, decision-making analytics and regulatory compliance functionality combined with customized, responsive and flexible programs to accelerate the success of all payments companies and solve tomorrow's payments challenges today. We hire energetic and creative employees while providing them the opportunity to excel in their careers and make a difference for our clients. Learn more about us and why we work here at https://www.galileo-ft.com/working-at-galileo.
#LI-KJ1

The role

You'll be extending and maintaining the financial backend that powers our clients. This includes the software that processes card transactions and bank transfers, as well as the underlying infrastructure.

What you'll do:

Lead the development and testing of our systems and services
Engage in shaping the technical architecture of the product
Help translate product requirements into user stories and technical solutions
Deliver highly available and scalable services in a production environment
Mentor other engineers, support the technical culture, and help grow the team
Write, test, and deploy efficient, scalable code to production that impacts millions of individuals
Generate ideas for new initiatives and technologies
Communicate with project leads, product managers and other software developers


What you'll need:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.
4+ years programming experience, ideally on a modern stack.
Hands-on experience with self-testing code (unit tests) and build systems.
Emerging ability to lead and influence a team's technical direction
Hands-on experience with database and cloud technologies
Emerging ability to design resilient software components within a distributed system.

Why you'll love working here:

Competitive salary packages and bonuses
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision and life insurance benefits
Generous vacation and holidays
Paid parental leave for eligible employees
Retirement plans and education on retirement planning
Monthly contribution up to $200 to help you pay off your student loans
Great health & well-being benefits including: telehealth parental support, subsidized gym program
Fully stocked kitchen (snacks and drinks)

The health and safety of our employees and their families is our top priority. Due to the ongoing nature of the COVID-19 pandemic, and because unvaccinated employees pose a direct threat to the health and safety of others in the workplace, effective on November 1, 2021, U.S. employees must be fully vaccinated to work from any of our offices, travel for business or attend work-related meetings.

CompanyLocation: San Francisco, CA 94105 (Financial District/South Beach area)
Content_text:
Senior Technical Program Manager
IT, InfoSec, Cyber Risk & Business Operations | San Francisco, California

This position is not eligible for employment in the following states: Alaska, Hawaii, Maine, Mississippi, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia, and Wyoming.

Our agreement with employees
DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agreeable for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what's right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you'll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.

The team
Our IT, InfoSec, Cyber Risk & Business Ops team - is in the business of trust and reliability. We create, maintain, and operate scalable technology and data solutions that deliver an exceptional experience for our internal & external customers. We embrace Agile principles and values, favor DevOps practices, and view infrastructure as code, all while we create an infrastructure that scales and supports our growth and ambitious vision. This requires a smart, highly collaborative team who can identify, investigate, and implement new technologies to continue securely scaling our global business.

This position

The Senior Technical Program Manager will drive the timely delivery of systems and enterprise projects to support key strategic initiatives in the Digital Technology Services organization. This position requires a highly driven individual with demonstrated experience in delivering projects in fast paced technical environments. The successful candidate will have proven ability to drive consensus and provide direction to multiple cross-functional stakeholders while maintaining efficient plans, tracking issues, and proactively communicating project status.

This position is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Director, Technology Program Management and is designated Flex.

Responsibilities

Create and manage all project management artifacts including project plan, issues & risks log, budgets, and status updates
Prioritize and balance between competing priorities to deliver outcomes on-time and on-budget
Run meetings and set agendas effectively, and track performance against agreed upon commitments
Communicate with business stakeholders and team members. Set and continually manage project expectations with team members and partners on an ongoing basis
Prepare and deliver presentations to facilitate alignment, and develop a shared understanding of the impacts, benefits, and changes to expect
Drive collaboration with project sponsor/s to plan project objectives, scope and deliverables
Develop and communicate project status, KPI's and project documentation to stakeholders, sponsor/s and executives
Manage vendor relationships and review scope of work in agreements
Collaborate with Project Management and Change Enablement professionals across DocuSign sharing leading practices and evolve our methodology

Basic qualifications

Strong experience in technology enterprise applications implementation, planning, execution, and delivery
Oracle Financials (PO, AP, AR GL, etc.), Oracle Supplier Management implementation experience
8+ years of combined Technical Program Management with a proven track record of delivery
5+ years of experience of project management best practices and Agile methodology
3+ years of experience in JIRA and Confluence with demonstrated capability using JIRA and Confluence to manage Agile scrum teams
Experience with business applications and Agile software development methodologies and productivity tools, including Jira, Confluence, ServiceNow, Smartsheet, G-Suite etc.
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience

Preferred qualifications

Ability to quickly understand complex issues and develop/apply simplifying frameworks to facilitate broader organizational understanding, decision-making and action
Detail-oriented with excellent verbal, written, organizational, presentation and interpersonal communications skills
Ability to present and explain complex information in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others and gains understanding
Adept at building close working relationships and quickly establishing personal credibility across an organization, maintaining a high level of professionalism, self-motivation, and a strong sense of urgency

Vaccination requirement (US)
DocuSign requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Therefore, to ensure the safety and well being of our employees and community, to support public health efforts, and comply with the Executive Order that applies to federal contractors, this offer is conditioned upon submission of written proof, prior to your start date, that you are fully vaccinated. DocuSign will comply with applicable law regarding the reasonable accommodation of individuals with disabilities and/or sincerely held religious beliefs.

About us
DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, over a million customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. And we help save the world's forests and embrace environmental sustainability.

It's important to us that we build a talented team that is as diverse as our customers and where all employees feel a deep sense of belonging and thrive. We encourage great talent who bring a range of perspectives to apply for our open positions. DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes hiring decisions based on experience, skill, aptitude and a can-do approach. We will not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected category.

Accommodations
DocuSign provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures, including if you have any difficulty using our online system. If you need such an accommodation, you may contact us at accommodations@docusign.com.

Rakuten Advertising, headquartered in San Mateo, California provides digital marketing and advertising services with rich consumer insights that help brands reach new customers and sustain loyalty. Media solutions is an important part of the portfolio, and we are looking for a strong Engineering Leader that is innovative and has great experience in product development, quality assurance, and DevOps. Experience in engineering in an RTB environment is an advantage. This role reports to the CTO of Rakuten Advertising.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead local and remote software engineering teams

Co-manage team strategy and OKRs with Product and Product Design counterparts, while driving success against the strategy and OKRs

Be a leader in technology trends and evolving social behavior of the engineering team under you to support the successful build and delivery of world-class software

Manage and foster individual and team growth of your local and remote teams

Establish standards of performance and monitor the performance of technology systems that the team owns.

Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, accountability, and operational excellence

Lead agile planning processes to achieve engineering goals by identifying and prioritizing development agile stories and setting timetables for the evaluation, development, and deployment of technology builds

Recruit, hire, and manage the performance of your staff, including personal improvement, mentorship, performance reviews

Measurably improve both discovery and delivery efficiency for product development teams

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS (Knowledge, Skills, Abilities)

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
10+ years of Software Engineering experience building large scale service-backed consumer-facing web and mobile SSP / RTB solutions

7+ years in a leadership role including managing Engineering leaders/managers

Successfully transitioned organizations to modern Engineering processes and tools

Demonstrated experience using real-world data and analytics to drive both product and team improvements and success

Deep understanding of mobile app and web app ecosystems and technology

Demonstrated ability to plan, organize and execute strategic initiatives to advance and drive product direction and vision

Proven track record for hiring, retaining, and developing talent

Strong ability to communicate, motivate and energize across the entire product development organization

Thorough understanding of various development methodologies to drive overall communication, efficiency, and quality

Natural desire to continuously improve

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent experience

Broad knowledge of industry and trends in Media, Programmatic and eCommerce

Experience with both startups and established companies

Experience driving security and privacy best practices

Experience in a B2B2C business

RAKUTEN SHUGI PRINCIPLES

Our worldwide practices describe specific behaviors that make Rakuten unique and united across the world. We expect Rakuten employees to model these 5 Shugi Principles of Success.

Always improve, always advance. Only be satisfied with complete success - Kaizen

Be passionately professional. Take an uncompromising approach to your work and be determined to be the best

Hypothesize - Practice - Validate - Shikumika. Use the Rakuten Cycle to succeed in unknown territory

Maximize Customer Satisfaction. The greatest satisfaction for workers in a service industry is to see their customers smile

Speed!! Speed!! Speed!! Always be conscious of time. Take charge, set clear goals, and engage your team

#LI-AT1

Company Description
As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.
At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.
You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays.

Job Description
About Global Commercial Payments Platform – B2B Connect
We are working on multiple technology stacks and want to add a highly motivated Engineer to our Commercial Payments organization in Foster City, CA. Visa's Commercial Payments organization is responsible for managing Visa's B2B Payment Global adoption on Cross-Border funds movement, innovation agenda and the management of strategic partnerships with critical financial institutions. This group is responsible for defining and building the Non-Card based payment innovation and product for Visa Inc. Globally. This includes:
Distributed-Ledger based Cross border payment platform
Near time Settlement
Enterprise ID stamping to create a digital identity for corporate entities
Hyperledger chain-code development
End-to-End Payment eco-system
Analytics and Data visualization
You can learn more about our work here:
Visa B2B Connect Launches Globally
Essential Functions
Work on emerging technologies, building distributed applications
Collaborate with project team members (Product Managers, Architects, Analysts, Software Engineers, Project Managers, etc.) to ensure development and implementation of new data driven business solutions.
Drive development effort End-to-End for on-time delivery of high quality solutions that conform to requirements, conform to the architectural vision, and comply with all applicable standards.
Collaborate with senior technical staff and PM to identify, document, plan contingency, track and manage risks and issues until all are resolved
Present technical solutions, capabilities, considerations, and features in business terms. Effectively communicate status, issues, and risks in a precise and timely manner.
Partner with Product on implementation strategy.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

10 years of work experience with a Bachelor's Degree in a related field or at least 8 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree or at least 3 years of work experience with a PhD

Preferred Qualifications:
12 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or 8-10 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 6+ years of work experience with a PhD

BS in Computer Science10+ years of experience with distributed software developmentHands-on experience with all aspects of software development: data, server-side, UI, and open-source softwareExperience in handling large data volume and having strong knowledge in Data wrangling and data pipeline is must haveExperience with Linux, Open source, C++ or Java, client-server appsExpertise in at least two of the following: Java / Go / Scala / Python,Familiar with container strategies and ecosystems such as Docker, KubernetesKnowledge of cloud architecture and scalable solutions including orchestration
BlockChain technical expertise is a plus
Visa has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. What we are building
Have you ever wondered if there was a way to predict if a new release is going to break a critical user journey? Are you feeling frustrated that regardless of how much testing is done before a release, you can’t seem to detect the issues that impact the Customer Experience before your users do?
If so, RelicX is the breakthrough solution you may be looking for. It uses AI/ML to continuously learn user behavioral patterns from live user interactions, automatically generates tests to validates user flow actions in the CI/CD pipeline, and scores the application release readiness based on the predicted CX-impact.
About Us
RelicX is co-founded by Sushil Kumar (CEO) and Gurashish Brar (CTO) who have several years of industry experience building and selling DevOps solutions at large companies like Oracle and Microsoft. Sushil ran a $200M DevOps business at CA Technologies/Broadcom as the General Manager, managing a team of 300+ spanning engineering, product management, marketing, and sales. Gurashish is an IIT/GeorgiaTech alumni who previously worked at Microsoft and BloomReach, and co-founded and sold his previous startup (Opas.ai) to Rubrik.
We are backed by Unusual Ventures and industry legends such as Jyoti Bansal (AppDynamics founder), John Vrionis (Lead investor in AppDynamics, Nicira, and Nimble Storage), and Ajeet Singh (ThoughtSpot founder CEO, Nutanix co-founder).
Location

As a born-in-pandemic company, we operate a fully remote team with office locations in the San Francisco Bay Area and Bengaluru, India.
What You Will Do
Join a Rockstar engineering team: You will be joining an all-star engineering team comprising Stanford-ians, Berkelites, and IITians, drawn from marquee companies such as Google, Microsoft, Rubrik, and Rippling.
Architect and build product: You will own the end-to-end development of a key part of our product. You will work closely with our founding team and customer design partners to shape and define what we build.
Define and shape culture: As a founding member, you’ll have the opportunity to define our engineering culture. A company is only as amazing as the set of people who comprise it - so you’ll help set the foundation for the next 10yrs of RelicX.
About Role
You will be building a large-scale real-time data ingestion framework, with streaming analytics of User activity tracked across multiple customers, highly visible consumer or business applications.
You will work with Data Scientist / ML engineers to perform sophisticated behavior analytics based on the incoming user session stream at a very large scale, as well as storing data into a scalable backend with fast analytics. You will be responsible for running multiple streaming pipelines performing data transformation, analysis, summarization.
You will be leveraging the cutting edge cloud technologies to build low maintenance and auto scaling and robust systems
About you
You should have 3-5 years of experience, preferably in a startup, or high growth and fast-paced enterprise
Prior experience in building SaaS products will be a big plus. So, will a master degree in computer science.
Expertise in Typescript and Python programming, Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS.
Prior exposure to building highly scalable, data-driven applications will be a big plus
Comfortable working in a globally distributed, fully remote, and diverse team
Benefits
Seed/Founding Stage Equity
Health, Vision and Dental
401K
Generous PTO/Sick Leave

CoderPad's mission is to improve the technical interviewing experience with tools that allow for standardization and consistency, in the name of reducing bias and increasing equality of opportunity.
What does a Software Engineer at CoderPad do?
As a Full Stack Engineer, you'll join a team focused on initiatives that position CoderPad as the best tool for interviewing and assessing technical talent. Developers love us!
Your work will impact the user experience of candidates and interviewers and pave the way in improving the technical hiring process – reducing bias for the next generation of engineers. You'll tie your work to metrics that drive CoderPad’s business and individual feature usage that propels our product-led growth motion. We collaborate with Product Managers, Designers, User Researchers, and other engineers to define project plans and solve the most impactful problems to delight CoderPad's customers.
Do you have an iterative mindset, a passion for building simple tools that solve real problems, and a love for tackling big challenges? If so, we can’t wait to meet you! Your manager will be the VP of Engineering.
Key Sample Projects
Improving the way specific engineering roles are assessed on CoderPad, by allowing candidates to showcase their skills in an environment that resembles their day-to-day work
Adding new tools for hiring managers to create consistent and fair interview processes that reduce bias
Iterating on Drawing Mode to enable easier creation of architectural and systems diagrams
Updating built-in package offerings for our 30+ supported languages
Launching, monitoring, and maintaining experiments and feature rollouts
Successful Experience
2-6+ years of professional programming experience with at least 1 year working full stack (just let us know if you want to focus on one side)
Proficiency with Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, React, HTML, CSS, and related web technologies
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced start-up environment, making pragmatic architectural choices and maintaining high engineering standards
Knowledge of cross-browser compatibility issues and client-side performance considerations
Responsible for understanding business requirements and owning a feature
Familiarity with GraphQL and Typescript, and interested in other tech we use, e.g. JSS, NodeJS, Docker, Ansible
CoderPad is a fully remote company, so employees can work from anywhere in the U.S. Therefore, qualified candidates must reside in the United States and be able to work as full-time employees in the U.S. without current or future visa sponsorship. (TN visas are considered on a case by case basis.)
Thinking about applying? Read this from the CEO: https://coderpad.io/blog/thinking-about-joining-coderpad!
Company Overview
CoderPad is on a mission to fix the technical interview process. We serve over 3,300 customers and have hosted more than 3 million technical interviews in 30+ programming languages since our launch in 2013.

Through simplicity, speed and accuracy, CoderPad has become a leading interview platform for hiring teams that need a reliable solution to identify better technical candidates – more fairly! It works like an IDE to emulate real-world scenarios and is easily personalized to specific team needs, ensuring a positive experience for the candidate and interviewer alike. That’s why top companies around the world, like Netflix, Slack and Snowflake, rely on CoderPad to help them prioritize quality talent and scale their hiring efforts.
Benefits for You
We are a small, geographically distributed team. We value the contribution of every team member – personally and professionally. If you enjoy working with a diverse group that feels like a family, we are interested in hearing from you.
Meaningful work with high impact for a well-loved productCompetitive, market-rate salariesStock options with 4-yr vesting scheduleMedical, dental, vision insurance (typically 100% covered for employees)401K with profit sharing ($3,000/yr)Unlimited paid time off (+"Summer Fridays"=every other Friday off)Remote-friendly environment + monthly stipend ($300/mo)Mac computer + in-home work station setup ($400)Parental leave full coverage (primary: 16 wks; secondary: 12 wks)Short-term disability coverage and life insurance policy
Internal mobility and growth opportunitiesDiversity and social good initiativesAnnual company-wide offsite with travel, accommodations & meals covered
And more…
CoderPad is committed to hiring the best talent. All applicants will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, national origin, religion, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran or disability status. Our goal is to be a diverse team that represents a variety of backgrounds and perspectives and a culture where everyone feels included.

DeepSight Technology Inc. of Los Altos, CA is currently hiring for a detail-oriented full-time Imaging Software Developer to join our medical imaging technology team. This full-time position works remotely or at one of our US offices in the St. Louis or San Francisco Bay areas, and earns a competitive salary. We are an established medical imaging technology company and believe that hard work can also be fun.
In addition to excellent pay and our positive work culture, we offer our Imaging Software Developer the following benefits and perks:
Health, vision, and dental coverage
Stock options
401(k)-retirement plan
If we've piqued your interest and you're ready to apply, it's easy! Just fill out our initial mobile-friendly online application. We hope to meet you soon!
OUR IDEAL CANDIDATE
Self-Motivated - sees what needs to get done and takes initiative to do it
Team Player - works well with others and enjoys being a part of a team
Effective Communicator - communicates with clarity and confidence
Analytical - can effectively analyze situations and problem solve in order to find appropriate solutions and/or make adaptations
Optimistic - approaches every situation with positivity and optimism that is contagious
If these ideal traits describe you, please continue reading!
ABOUT DEEPSIGHT TECHNOLOGY INC.
DeepSight Technology Inc. is a stealth mode startup company that has developed breakthrough technology in ultrasound imaging. This new technology will extend both the range and clarity over current systems by 10x - 100x! We are setting new standards that will dramatically improve the capabilities of ultrasound for many years.
In order to develop and improve this technology, we need dedicated team players on our side. Not only do we offer a great team-oriented environment, but we also offer competitive compensation and generous benefits.
IMAGING SOFTWARE DEVELOPER REQUIREMENTS
In this Imaging Software Developer position, we rely on you to effectively develop various signal and image processing algorithms for our advanced ultrasound systems. You work alongside our transducer, hardware, and systems teams to work on optimizing the design of our system prototypes and products. You regularly utilize your knowledge and skillset to help develop the software architecture of our next-generation, high-quality medical imaging systems. Additionally, you utilize Python, C/C++, or CUDA to design our imaging pipeline and implement its components. Your optimistic, team-oriented approach to your role results in productivity and fulfillment as you see your hard work pay off in the future advancements of our medical imaging technology!
Completed Master's in an engineering or computer science field OR equivalent industry experience
At least 5 years of experience in commercial software development
Previous experience with GPU programming (CUDA or OpenCL)
Previous experience with programming environment tools and IDEs such as Visual Studio or Eclipse
Previous experience with UX design and modern UI graphics frameworks, including Qt, WPF, and OpenGL
Programming skills in Python, C++, or CUDA
Top-notch signal and image processing skills
Experience designing software architecture for medical systems and expertise in medical imaging methods like beamforming, Doppler, MRI, or CT would be helpful but are not necessarily required. Are you proud of your hard work and effort? Can you manage multiple tasks without sacrificing quality and accuracy? Is being dependable, professional, and a team player at the heart of all you do? If yes, give us the chance to review your information.
ARE YOU READY?
If you are excited about this Imaging Software Developer opportunity, don't delay. Apply today!

Company Description
Medable's mission is to get effective therapies to patients faster. We provide an end-to-end, cloud-based platform with a flexible suite of tools that allows patients, healthcare providers, clinical research organizations and pharmaceutical sponsors to work together as a team in clinical trials. Our solutions enable more efficient clinical research, more effective healthcare delivery, and more accurate precision and predictive medicine. Our target audiences are patients, providers, principal investigators, and innovators who work in healthcare and life sciences.
Our vision is to accelerate the path to human discovery and medical cures. We are passionate about driving innovation and empowering consumers. We are proactive, collaborative, self-motivated learners, committed, bold and tenacious. We are dedicated to making this world a healthier place.

Job Description

Lead the Product Management team to create and drive a user experience vision for all Medable products.
Define key performance metrics and ensure cross-team alignment.
Develop, define, and oversee the product’s roadmap and manage it as required for the purpose of meeting deliverables.
Provide direction to the design, product, and research teams from conceptual work through execution.
Help us scale rapidly by reinforcing a design-driven culture that leverages the best product, technology, and innovative talent.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

10+ years experience in full product lifecycle management or a combination of education and experience in this field
5+ years of experience in a leadership role
Bachelor’s degree computer science, computer engineering, business or a related field
MBA preferred
Salesforce, JIRA, Confluence, Prototyping/wireframing tools, G-Suite/MS Office suite experience preferred
Additional Information

Demonstrated experience setting UX vision and innovation
Demonstrated ability to lead a team to execute against, and optimize across, a portfolio of products, projects, and teams simultaneously
Experience working for early-stage and late stage startups preferred
Operational excellence in running high-performing teams
Understanding of key business metrics, data and how it relates to design
Excellent cross-disciplinary collaboration skills and strong organizational agility
