Based in San Francisco, CA, Rippling has raised $450M from the world's top investors—including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, and Sequoia—and was named one of America's best startup employers by Forbes (#12 out of 500).

Rippling is the first way for businesses to manage their HR & IT — from payroll and benefits, to employee computers and apps — all in one, modern system.

In just 90-seconds, a company can set up (or disable) an employee's payroll, health insurance, work computer, and third-party apps, like Gmail, Microsoft Office, and Slack. It's the only platform that truly unifies every employee system, and automates all of the administrative work.

Rippling is headquartered in San Francisco and has raised over $200M from top-tier investors, including Founders Fund, Greenoaks Capital, Coatue Management, Kleiner Perkins, and YCombinator.

About The Role

The AppLearn team is a brand new team currently responsible for building and maintaining Rippling's Applicant Tracking System (ATS) and Learning Management System (LMS). These are critical systems to recruit and train employees while remaining compliant with state laws. Both in-house and third-party integrations are supported in these areas which let customers choose what works best for them. Our goal is to provide the best customer experience in both areas, reduce manual work using automation, and provide useful reports to take action. We are a small team working on multiple new product initiatives and growing quickly.

As a software engineer, you will have an opportunity to design and develop new product initiatives from the ground up with the most talented engineers on the team. You will be playing a crucial role in building team culture and growing the team.

What You'll Do:
Develop high-quality software with attention to detail
Ship incrementally and continually at high velocity
Confidently ship small/moderate features and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members. Collaborate with the team on larger projects
Review and share feedback on code and features
Implement comprehensive unit tests for confirming functionality and the quality of code.
Ensure high-quality code and related documentation.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent
Strong CS fundamentals
Minimum 2 years of development experience
You want to be part of a team of the most talented, forward-thinking engineers in the industry
You're passionate about being in a product-focused environment where everyone cares deeply about customer impact

Nice-to-haves:

Hands-on development experience using Python, Django, MongoDB, React, AWS
Domain knowledge in Applicant Tracking and Learning Management Systems

If you don't necessarily meet all of the requirements listed here, we still encourage you to apply because skills can be used in lots of different ways, your life experience is equally important sometimes.

Benefits:
Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, HSA, Commuter, Life and Disability Benefits
Uncapped PTO
Flexible work hours
Generous parental leave
Transgender health insurance coverage
Great compensation package (salary, equity)
Meeting-light culture
Onsite meals

Even if you don't meet all of the requirements listed here, we still encourage you to apply. Skills can be used in lots of different ways and your life and professional experience may be relevant beyond what a list of requirements will capture.

Rippling is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce and do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected characteristics. Rippling is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities who need assistance during the hiring process. To request a reasonable accommodation, please email accommodations@rippling.com.


We are committed both to the health of our employees and to promoting a safe and collaborative workplace, and vaccinations are the best way to end the COVID-19 pandemic and to protect our community. In the U.S., where permitted under federal and state law, all offers of employment will be conditioned upon new hires providing proof of vaccination prior to their start date, unless the individual qualifies for an accommodation. For all other locations, vaccinations are strongly encouraged.

JobTitle: Associate Director of Technical Program Management, Supplier
Content_text:
Associate Director of Technical Program Management (Supplier)

Wayfair is looking for an Associate Director of Technical Program Management leader to organize and drive the technology initiatives that support our Supplier Engineering team. Our team is now building cutting-edge applications and self-service tools which will aid Wayfair sellers in every step of the e-commerce journey. From onboarding to creating and updating their product catalog, to improving the merchandising and pricing of individual products - we will be offering guidance and recommending world-class solutions at every step. Our goal is to make it as easy for anyone to sell on Wayfair as it is to buy from Wayfair.

The Supplier Engineering team has been tasked with spearheading the next set of major growth for Wayfair as we strive towards our goal of growing from a $15B company to a $100B company. With this comes the opportunity for you to work on and lead high-visibility projects that have an extremely high impact on Wayfair. Furthermore, you will be green fielding the way we’re going to build applications for our sellers going forward.

As a Senior Technical Program Manager, you will be primarily responsible for scoping and delivering large projects end-to-end. Responsibilities include ownership of a program encompassing one or more products, driving project schedules from design to release, and managing the program launch. You will be making appropriate tradeoffs to optimize for quality and time-to-market, clearly communicating goals, roles, responsibilities, and desired outcomes to internal and external cross-functional and remote project teams.

The right candidate will possess a strong program management background, will have demonstrated experience leading medium to large projects, and will have a well-rounded technical background in current software and/or hardware disciplines. You must be able to thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment, and not be hindered by ambiguity or competing priorities. This means you are not only able to develop and drive high-level strategic initiatives but can also roll up your sleeves, dig in, and get the job done.

An ideal candidate will be entrepreneurial, innovative (both with technology and in getting things done), and highly influential. They will love using technology to solve complex problems in a high-growth environment with a passionate and engaged team and advocating for the needs of our 21 million customers. The ideal candidate will have strong communication, organization, and planning skills. They will be able to create repeatable program frameworks leveraging methodologies like scaled agile or hybrid frameworks that make multiple teams come together to deliver the value.

Who We Are:

Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, we make it possible for 21 million shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 14 million items across home furnishings, décor, home improvement, housewares, and more. Partnering with Engineering, Product Management, Experience Design, Analytics, and business leaders across Wayfair, our teams ensure that we’re building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, and measurable ways.

In This Role, You Will:

Define the mission, vision, and guiding principles for the program management office; setting the objectives, analyzing the data to inform decisions, driving outcomes, and influencing the resourcing of your key initiatives.
Define framework and tools for world-class program management practices. Standardize the practices, tools, and frameworks across the organization.
Create buy-in for the technical vision and execution plan both internally and across key partners
Present at multiple internal and external forums key goals and progress towards those goals
Lead planning and prioritization for product, design, marketing and engineering teams
Build a team to run multiple Supplier tech initiatives
Drive the creation of scalable, cross-cutting solutions from concept to delivery with your cross-functional technology partners; you’ll be able to zoom into the weeds of a solution or back out to the SVP-level to communicate constraints and outcomes.
Create plans that have clear, measurable success criteria, and clearly communicate progress and outcomes.
Create roadmaps and plans that have a clear series of milestones, measurable success criteria, and clearly communicate progress and outcomes.
Simplify complexity for the team, drive smart tradeoff decisions, and deliver incremental value.
Force multiply the efforts of many teams to deliver impact by removing bottlenecks before they become roadblocks, optimizing working models, and instrumenting repeatable processes.
Own the prevention of traditional failures: bad understanding of the customer/business problem, weak collaboration, interdependencies not being mapped, weak technical solutioning (debt), gaps in testing, or unclear success measurement.
Communicate and align with senior leadership, both within the Engineering and Operational organizations. You will effectively paint with context and drive high-quality decisions.

What You’ll Need:

A track record of delivering complicated software solutions (products, systems, features) in a scaled agile environment.
Understanding how distributed systems and software solutions are built to help guide the product development, peer group.
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Build positive, trusting relationships through consistent, on-time delivery of commitments and effective communication
Build the technical and execution strategy and vision
Exercise technical judgment in working with large, cross-functional teams.
Manage programs, define milestones and success criteria, and allocate resources.
Develop tools and processes to improve program productivity.
An entrepreneurial mindset, with a bias for customer-focused innovation.
Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated experience turning data into actionable insights.
A BS in computer science or a related technical discipline or MBA with a focus on tech and engineering management
5-7 years of experience in software engineering, software product management, software development management, or technical program management.

About Wayfair Inc.

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

SOFTWARE DEVELOPER


Why Provident?

Provident Credit Union was established in 1950. We rank among the top 10% of credit union in the US and was recently named the Best Credit Union in California by Forbes magazine for 2021. We believe having a culture that is accepting, supportive, diverse and inclusive makes us all better. We are a winner of the Bay Area News Group Top Work Place 5 years in a row. Our mission is we Listen, Get Better and Do What's Right for each other and our members.


Job Summary:

The Software Developer is responsible for designing and testing program logic, coding programs, program documentation and preparation of programs for computer operations. Applies change management techniques and procedures when updating software. Individual is encouraged and expected to provide coding efficiencies and value adds to new and existing software


Essential Functions:

Codes, Tests, Debugs and documents modified and new programs.
Uses coding methods for specific programming language to enhance or initiate efficient program execution and performance and to reach optimum hardware use.
Monitors production programs for expected performance and responds to errors and emergency problems.
Works within specifications provided to meet programming assignment goals and objectives in a timely and accurate manner.
Takes independent action to correct problems encountered during systems operations within authority level granted by the IT Operations Manager.
Maintains integrity of program logic and coding, and establishes required checks and balances for operational controls.
Maintains up-to-date knowledge of computer operating procedures and operating standards.
Assists in studying and analyzing data processing functions, methods and procedures, and makes recommendations concerning the feasibility of revising existing programs or adapting new applications to data processing operations that will more effectively use Technology resources
Produces procedural and technical documentation as required.
Works directly with Business Systems Analyst to deliver bug free solutions that meet objectives and specifications stated by the requestor in the Business Requirements Document (BRD).
Adhere to System Development Guidelines including but not limited to Change Management Procedures.
Designs programs following naming and coding conventions established by the organization.
Evaluate, present, and implement solutions as needed, specifically for Digital Channels with an emphasis on home and mobile banking.
Novice to Adequate skills at providing estimates and work breakdowns to management staff.
Report periodically to various entities in the organization, stakeholders, customers, end users, etc. that have made programming requests.
Prepare reports on the status, operation and maintenance of applications and system software for use by other IT and support staff.
Performs other duties as assigned
Excellent listening and speaking skills.
Complete required BSA & OFAC training annually
Understand and adhere to BSA and OFAC policy and procedures.


Education/Work Experience/Skills and Abilities:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Technology or related discipline. Courses in business and information systems necessary to develop and maintain position proficiency.
3+ years of related experience, preferably in credit union or financial institutions environment.
Ability to write efficient and maintainable code using object-oriented principles.
Ability to work independently with minimal or no supervision.
Proficiency with Windows operating system.
Proficiency in Windows operating systems and .NET framework
Proficiency in development tools including Visual Studio
Proficiency in computer languages C#, JavaScript, Visual Basic, SQL, XML.
Proficiency working with Client/Server architectures at various levels.
Proficiency using MS SQL Server as administrator, programmer and analyst
Knowledge of SOAP, WPF application development, Windows Forms, XML Web Services, LINQ, MVC Architecture, ASP.NET development, and SQL Server interfacing
Must be able to apply logical thinking to define problems, establish facts and draw valid conclusions. Technical Capacity.
Must be able to provide interpreted technical instructions to a non-technical audience.


Benefits You will enjoy:

Fully paid health insurance premiums for employees
Quality medical, dental and vision care coverage
401(k) retirement plan with up to 150% matching employer contributions
Strong commitment to investing in your career and educational advancement by offering up to 100% Tuition reimbursement for approved courses
Annual bonus/profit sharing
Generous paid time off, paid holidays and additional summer time off
Flexible spending accounts
Short and long-term disability coverage
Life and AD&D insurance
Provident membership
Wellness programs: Yoga, Tai Chi, in-house gym
Rate discount on home, auto loans and personal loans
Walking distance to restaurants
Close proximity to Cal Train station


Provident is an Equal Opportunity Employer

We are a winner of the Bay Area News Group Top Work Place in 2017 - 2020. Check us out on Glassdoor

About Boxbot
If you’ve ever wanted to get in on the ground floor of a robotics company that is poised to transform a massive and exciting industry in the short term, Boxbot is the company for you! Our product builds upon rapid advancements in the material handling automation industry from the last two decades with a unique approach that will change the way e-commerce packages are delivered to our doorsteps.
We’re a close-knit team that has been pursuing our vision since 2017. As a Series A company with $20M in funding raised to date, we’re quickly expanding in order to bring our product to market soon. Every new team member will have a foundational role with significant creative ownership within their focus area. We are seeking teammates who take pride in their work and who get excited about building and iterating on new systems with significant responsibility.
 As a software engineer with a focus in C++ programming, you will be responsible for developing and delivering high quality and low latency robotics application software for Boxbot’s advanced material handling facility. Come join a small but highly committed team of software engineers that strives to deliver robust and reliable warehouse automation/control software and help drastically modernize package delivery automation.
responsibilities
Drive design of server level applications that coordinate actions of dozens of subsystems in our automated material handling facility
Design, develop and debug low latency data processing systems in a compiled server side language (C++) to monitor and control automation robotics.
Drive the development of a high performance Warehouse Execution System with an eye towards scalability, modularity, robustness, and tight integrations with the hardware.
Influence continuous improvements and best software development practices within the team
Requirements
BS, preferably MS or higher degree in Computer Science especially if work experience is limited
5+ years of professional experience developing and deploying production level robotics and automation systems
Experience with C++ (preferred) within a linux environment interfacing with Hardware [C is okay]
Experience with in memory databases (Redis in particular) preferred
Experience with modern version control systems (Git etc)
Experience designing distributed data processing systems (Pub/Sub, TCP/UDP, gRPC etc) preferred
Experience with cloud compute infrastructure (Docker etc) preferred
Experience with test driven development is preferable. Our developers are involved significantly with testing and validation as well, as such a test and validation mindset is needed.
Bonus: Startup experience and entrepreneurial mindset
We are headquartered in Oakland, CA in the Jack London Square area with an easy commute via Bart, Ferry, Amtrak and free parking. We take the well being of our teammates seriously, with benefits including medical, dental, vision, life and more! We also allow for flexible work schedules and remote options when possible.
If you love new projects, building awesome products and getting stuff done, then we want to talk to you! Simply submit your information below.

JobTitle: AppD Software Development Engineer in Test (Install and Conf...
CompanyLocation: San Francisco, CA 94107 (Financial District/South Beach area)
Content_text:
About You
You are passionate about having an in-depth understanding of application customers, distributed micro-service applications in IaaS environments, and the current needs of the industry, with a focus on quality and automation. You are comfortable working on multiple programming languages and are eager to work independently and learn new ones when the scope of the project demands it. You also have:

Basic Skills:
Computer Science or equivalent Engineering degree.
5+ years of experience in testing Web & API based products.
Significant experience developing software e.g. with Java (preferred), golang, bash/shell scripting, powershell etc.
Experience in building & improving automated testing frameworks, tools, automated test suites, TestNG, and Linux.
Extensive experience writing test applications to closely resemble customer applications and use cases.
Hands-on knowledge of Docker and K8s and maintaining CI pipelines.
Experience in working with web servers & application servers.
Experience with AWS (preferred) or one of the other Cloud Service Providers (Azure, GCP etc.)

Advanced Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a high aptitude to learn and adapt to new test frameworks and software deployment models.
Thorough understanding and experience with distributed systems and micro-services architectures.
Experience with Component, Contract, and End to End testing frameworks using RESTful or similar APIs.
Comfortable with Python and writing scripts to deploy automated test setups.

Breadth of knowledge and skills:
Experienced at creating automation for Continuous Integration/ Continuous Deployment and DevOps culture.
Hands-on experience in open source projects is a bonus.

Attitude and working style:
Always looking to learn new technologies and are comfortable rolling up your sleeves.
Enjoy working in teams and working closely with developers to write high-quality code.
Willing to contribute to the wider team and help drive design discussions.

About the Role
You will be a QE counter-part of a highly collaborative Install & Config Team. The team builds products to deploy, configure and upgrade the Application and Infrastructure monitoring agents that are a core part of Appdynamics product portfolio. The product is based on a distributed microservice architecture.

This role is technically demanding with a need for programming, understanding application architecture, and a dedication to understanding how customers use our products on SaaS. Our top priority as the Quality Engineering team is test automation and constantly adapting to maintain very high quality. Each member of the Quality Engineering team will develop test applications, add to existing and build new framework/ tools, CI/CD processes, familiar with the latest DevOps processes and technologies being used in the industry.

We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking ambitious risks to craft the technologies that give us smart cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with outstanding personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. We are leaders with vision, tech enthusiasts, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are optimists and we are doers. Recently we have won the #1 employer in the World award. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

#appd_jobs

Our mission is to help people everywhere find a job and company they love. We're transforming the workplace experience through the power of transparency. As the worldwide leader in employer branding and insights, our vision is for a world where transparency empowers the workforce and motivates companies to become better employers.

Please note this role is open to remote hiring. Our main office locations are in San Francisco, CA, Chicago, IL and Uniontown, OH.

About the Role

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be working on the Glassdoor's Content Moderation & Fraud Engineering team. The Content Moderation and Fraud is passionate about building robust tools to ensure users continue to trust UGC on Glassdoor. It manages and improves the experience of manual and auto moderation of the user generated content on the Glassdoor website along with Fraud prevention and detection tools.

A typical week includes working with fellow Engineers and Product Managers and to understand and clarify new feature requests that support Glassdoor's business goals. You will collaborate with fellow Software Engineers across different teams to discover new ways of building features and services. You'll also have the opportunity to collaborate with Product and Design leaders to help scope and plan efforts.

Compensation: $128,000 - $160,000
At Glassdoor, operating transparently is at the heart of everything we do. That's why we let job seekers know that salary ranges may differ for jobs depending on where these positions are filled. It's no secret that the cost of living and other economic considerations vary widely across the country and the world.

At Glassdoor we apply a "tier" system to promote consistency in level of compensation for where roles are filled in different locations. The tiers are as follows:

Tier 1 encompasses the highest salary range for states where large metropolitan areas are located (ie: San Francisco, New York City, Washington DC, & etc)
Tier 2 encompasses salary ranges 15% less than those in Tier 1 for states with mid-sized cities (ie: Chicago, Dallas, Portland, etc)
Tier 3 encompasses salary ranges 20% less than those in Tier 1 for states with smaller
cities (including our Ohio office, Nevada, etc)

You can learn more about our compensation philosophy here and see salary ranges for all Glassdoor jobs here.

What You'll Do:

You have a passion for crafting high-quality services and APIs, and enjoy working closely with other specialists
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, and enjoy giving thoughtful feedback on things like pull requests and product specifications
You enjoy working closely with partners in different fields (engineering, product, and design) during the software development process
You recognize the value of shipping, and are able to make good trade-offs in order to get something into the hands of customers
You take phenomenal care when crafting and architecting services and APIs
You understand the value of testing, and make good decisions about what to test when building software

What You'll Bring

5+ years building high-quality, secure services for high-traffic websites.
Experience with Java or a JVM language like Kotlin.
Experience with Spring or another dependency injection framework.
Experience with databases like Postgres, MSSQL, or MySQL.
Experience designing and building RESTful or GraphQL APIs.
Experience building products and services in an agile environment.
Effective written and verbal communicator.
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a technical field (Engineering, Math, etc), or equivalent work experience.
Strong desire to add to our culture of diversity, equity and inclusion.

Nice to Have

Experience with AWS technologies like Lambda and SQS.
Experience with Elasticsearch and Redis.
Full-stack experience with React, Node, NPM, CSS, and other front-end technologies.

For more information about some of the exciting technology work being done at Glassdoor, check out our Engineering Blog!

Why Glassdoor?

100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage, with 80% dependent coverage.
Equity Incentives in our parent company's ADR (Recruit Holdings, Stock ID: 6098T).
Annual 10% bonus aligning with bi-annual performance reviews.
401(k) Plan with a Company Match to prepare for your future.
Generous paid holidays and open paid time off.

Our Commitments

Transparency: We are open and honest. We share information – the good and the bad – so we can continuously learn, collaborate and make the right decisions. Pay bands, our compensation philosophy, and employee feedback survey responses are shared publicly.
Innovation: We actively pursue new and different ways to further Glassdoor's mission. We forge our own path by challenging the status quo. The ultimate goal is not just to change how we operate at Glassdoor, but for every employer to follow our lead!
Good People: We work together with integrity, respect and compassion for one another. We have fun together! We are inclusive, fair and humble while remaining confident. We do the right thing, period.
GRIT: We are resilient, inventive and fearless. We see challenges as opportunities. With passion and courage, we come together to get the job done.
Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion: We are dedicated to building a company that is more diverse and representative of society at large. Glassdoor externally publishes our Diversity & Inclusion report and information about our employee population to hold ourselves accountable to our dedication. We also provide programs and resources to build a greater sense of belonging for our employees.

Glassdoor is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Glassdoor is an equal opportunity employer; committed to creating a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

CompanyLocation: San Francisco, CA 94105 (Financial District/South Beach area)
Content_text:
Our team helps customers proactively prevent payment fraud. Commerce and financial transactions are increasingly moving online. While the internet has enabled easier and instantaneous payments, it has also introduced a layer of anonymity between the transacting parties. To fully leverage the power of online commerce: there must be mutual trust between parties. Without trust, commerce cannot happen.

By providing a clear, accurate assessment of risk at multiple points of the end-user journey, we enable merchants to eliminate fraud losses, and create adaptive, frictionless experiences for low risk payments. We believe that machine learning is THE way to empower internet-scale businesses to prevent payment fraud.

What you'll do

Research and apply the latest machine learning algorithms to power our core business product
Build offline experimentation systems used to simultaneously evaluate tens of thousands of models
Work on maintaining and improving Sift's ML models and architecture.
Scale machine learning pipelines used to produce thousands of models derived from terabytes of data
Build systems that automatically explain how a model arrived at a prediction
Use data science techniques to analyze fraudulent behavior patterns
Collaborate with other teams to build new ways to use machine learning within Sift
Generate and execute on ideas to provide customers with meaningful and actionable insights to identify and prevent fraudulent behaviors and transactions
Leverage anomaly detection algorithms to identify unusual behaviors for customer traffic patterns
What would make you a strong fit
Practical understanding of machine learning and data science concepts, and a track record of solving problems with these methods
2+ years of experience working with production ML systems.
2+ years experience working with large datasets using Spark, MapReduce, or similar technologies
2+ years experience building backend systems using Java, Scala, Python, or other language
Experience training machine learning models end-to-end
Strong communication & collaboration skills, and a belief that team output is more important than individual output
Degree in Statistics, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, or a related field

Bonus points

Experience working with scalable, real-time prediction systems in production
Familiarity with multiple machine learning or statistical packages in Python, R, MATLAB, or another programming language
Experience evaluating model performance
Advanced degree in Statistics, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Operations Research, or a related field

A little about us:

Sift is the leading innovator in Digital Trust & Safety. Hundreds of disruptive, forward-thinking companies like Airbnb, Zillow, and Twitter trust Sift to deliver outstanding customer experience while preventing fraud and abuse.

The Sift engine powers Digital Trust & Safety by helping companies stop fraud before it happens. But it's not just another anti-fraud platform: Sift enables businesses to tailor experiences to each customer according to the risk they pose. That means fraudsters experience friction, but honest users do not. By drawing on insights from our global network of customers, Sift allows businesses to scale, win, and thrive in the digital era.

Benefits and Perks:

Competitive total compensation package
401k plan
Medical, dental and vision coverage
Wellness reimbursement
Education reimbursement
Flexible time off

Sift is an equal opportunity employer. We make better decisions as a business when we can harness diversity in our experience, data, and background. Sift is working toward building a team that represents the worldwide customers that we serve, inclusive of people from all walks of life who can bring their full selves to work every day.

This document provides transparency around the way in which Sift handles personal data of job applicants: https://sift.com/recruitment-privacy

CHANGE AN INDUSTRY
We’re disruptors, innovators, and doers who aren’t afraid to challenge what’s possible.
At Bright Machines, our mission is to change the speed, scalability, and flexibility of manufacturing. We bring software-defined intelligence down to the factory floor and enable our customers to modernize their manufacturing operations effortlessly.
Working at Bright Machines is an opportunity to be part of a growing team that enables anyone to build anything, anywhere. If you’re ready to apply your exceptional skills to create the platform that will define the next generation of manufacturing, we’d love to speak with you.
Let’s disrupt an industry. It will be fun!
ABOUT THE ROLE
Software Engineers at Bright Machines are responsible for defining and implementing the systems that make Software Defined Manufacturing possible and that power our microfactories (lines of robotic cells). Our robots, and the software that controls them, are deployed in a variety of physical and virtual factory environments and support the real manufacturing operations for some of the biggest names in the industry.
As a Principal Software Architect on our Cloud Platform team, you will create infrastructure as code and design scalable systems to deploy the microservices that help our team program, simulate, deploy and operate our microfactories. You will work on a team with other Software Engineers at Bright Machines to define, architect, implement and deploy our software stack – from robot to cloud.
This is a unique opportunity to be part of a greenfield development effort that will change the way companies build and produce products. If you’re ready to apply exceptional engineering practices and build the software that will define the next generation in manufacturing, this is your opportunity to “Be Bright”.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
Architect, design, develop and deploy the infrastructure that help realize Bright Machines vision of Software Defined Manufacturing
Contribute best-in-class programming skills to develop reliable and scalable platforms
Write clean, maintainable code, and perform peer code-reviews
Participate in architecture design reviews across areas of expertise
Create unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to ensure we are continually shipping code to production
Work with other team members to investigate design approaches, prototype new technology and evaluate technical feasibility
Work in an Agile/Scrum environment to deliver high quality software against aggressive schedules
Establish architectural principles, select design patterns and then mentor team members on their appropriate application
Help define and implement standards and promote best practices for distributed software systems
Analyze and optimize applications to maximize speed and scale
WHAT WE WANT TO SEE
B.S. degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field
10+ years of job experience in Senior Software Engineering or equivalent roles
Proficiency in a variety of modern programming languages (JavaScript, C#/C++, Python)
Solid understanding and application of Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)
Understanding of scaling and operational concerns for large software systems
Experience with maintaining live site health and driving on call teams
Ability to work in a variety of compute environments (Windows, Linux, AWS)
Knowledge and demonstrated application of software engineering best practices relating to the SDLC including coding standards, code reviews, SCM, CI/CD, testing, and operations
IT WOULD BE GREAT IF YOU HAD
M.S. degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field
Experience working directly with customers of your software
Experience communicating with users, technical leaders and management to collect requirements, describe system designs, and set product strategy
Demonstrated ability to mentor and grow other team members
Experience with hardware systems
WHO YOU ARE
You are customer obsessed
You believe in the power of a team, diversity of thought, and unity of action
You always act with integrity, keep your commitments, and practice transparency
You think boldly, lead with courage, and demand the highest standards
You drive for results and act like an owner
DO THE BEST WORK OF YOUR CAREER
You’ll be challenged and will grow from solving problems that will have real-world customer benefit. You’ll be encouraged to find creative and innovative solutions that have never been built.
We strike a balance between celebrating team success and a focus on individual growth. Paired with the best minds in the industry, your contributions will be impactful and significant as we disrupt a multi-billion-dollar industry.

Bright Machines was named a “Technology Pioneer” by the World Economic Forum, one of “America’s Most Promising Artificial Intelligence Companies” by Forbes, and an Inc. “Best in Business” winner.
Come join us.

San Francisco, Bay Area/ Temporarily Remote

At Motic Digital Pathology, we drive the adoption of digital solutions by making slide scanners and software-based pathology technology approachable for hospitals and labs everywhere. Our solutions connect doctors to make better clinical decisions every day, automate diagnostic procedures to expand service capacity at hospitals, and deliver specialist expertise to patients in even the most remote places.

We are looking for a resourceful, technically-minded Product Manager to conduct market research, liaise with our engineering and factory teams on product requirements, oversee product rollouts, and manage hardware and software implementation with our enterprise partners. Our ideal candidate blends a keen eye for design, a passion for products, and the organizational skills of a project manager.

In this position, you will:

Research and actively maintain our understanding of market needs, the competitive landscape, product-market fit, development and partnership opportunities, and customer experience

requirements in the digital pathology space

Continually identify and fill product feature gaps through visiting customers to solicit feedback and generate new ideas to evolve the customer experience and drive growth
Create buy-in for product vision, awareness, and understanding both internally in the Motic corporation and with key external partners
Translate product strategy into detailed requirements and prototypes for quick time-to-market execution with the engineering teams
Manage timeline prioritization and enforce product launch deadlines, including working cross-functionally with engineering, factory, marketing, and sales teams, as well as with Motic executives
Develop creative product positioning strategies for each application segment in our unique industry, and ensure our promotional plans from sales and marketing are effective and on message
Oversee the rollout process for new products and new product features to our end users, helping devise and implement strategic project planning with partners as needed
Manage projects in multiple geographical locations; travel to tradeshows and customers as required, several international trips per year likely as well, up to 20% of the time once COVID restrictions are lessened

We are looking for:

2+ years of experience in product management or project management; a proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle, from launch to end of life
Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies; the ability to oversee software integrations of existing platforms is a key part of ensuring the success of new product releases
UX design background; you love clean, beautiful, user-friendly design and can convey UX requirements to product engineers
Proven ability to develop product and marketing strategies and effectively communicate recommendations to executive management
Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done
Skilled at working effectively with cross-functional teams in a matrix organization
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent preferred, but coding academy candidates with a strong interest and background in technical products are also highly encouraged to apply
Fluency in Mandarin and/or proven experience working with native Mandarin speakers on technical projects a plus

Build the products that power global trade.

The opportunity:

Flexport's mission is to make global trade easy for everyone. To achieve this goal, the Flexport User Experience (UX) team creates end-to-end experiences for our clients, partners, and operations teams. We are seeking a User Researcher to build a deep understanding of users' problems and turn user research into actionable insights that drive decision making. This individual enjoys solving challenging problems and empowering the team to move forward by developing metrics, measuring results, and integrating new methodologies into existing systems. User Researchers are key stakeholders in the product development lifecycle, from collaborating with cross-functional partners and formulating the product vision to ensuring high-quality implementation. To be successful, User Researchers must be relentlessly curious, methodical, communicate clearly, and consistently balance user and business needs. Join us as we lay the foundation of our vision for global trade.

As a researcher on the Marketplace team, you will drive the end-to-end research initiatives across many functions and multiple tools. You'll inform product directions and decisions that enable us to create the best processes and strategies for procurement, pricing, sales, and financial purposes globally.

You will:
Establish domain knowledge and empathy for end users in a specific product area
Collaborate with cross-functional team to identify research opportunities and manage research priorities
Plan the research strategy, using appropriate methodologies to achieve product goals
Conduct a variety of user research activities, including surveys, field research, analogous research, co-creation, diary studies, usability testing (remote and in-person), etc.
Learn to incorporate quantitative data and qualitative research findings into actionable insights
Present research insights in a memorable and compelling narrative
Keep the team focused on the users throughout the product development lifecycle
Contribute to onboarding new researchers
You should have:
2+ years of professional user research experience
End-to-end experience with most aspects of research (study design, recruiting, moderation, analysis, storytelling)
Solid communication, presentation, social, and analytical skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization
Experience applying research insights to creative design solutions
Experience working in highly collaborative design teams, or other multidisciplinary teams
A degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Statistics, Sociology, Psychology, Anthropology or related field, or equivalent practical experience
Worried about not having any logistics experience?

Don't be! Our mission is to make global trade easy for everyone. That's why it's important to bring people from diverse backgrounds and experiences together with our industry veterans to help move the global logistics industry forward.

We know this industry is complex. That's why we invest in education starting day one with Flexport Academy, a one week intensive onboarding program designed specifically to set every new Flexport employee up for success.

At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global trade easy for everyone relies on having a diverse, dedicated and engaged workforce. That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

#LI-AC3

Borrego is seeking a Data Analyst to join our growing team. Are you passionate about renewable energy, addressing the climate crisis, and accelerating the clean energy transformation? Are you excited to ask questions, push boundaries and boldly go where the data leads you? If so, the Data and Analytics team at Borrego wants to talk to you! We offer a hybrid work environment, allowing you to work remotely 2-3 days a week and from the office 2-3 days a week.We are looking for a savvy Data Analyst to join us as we build an analytics platform that will allow our businesses to answer "what", "when" and "how" as well as "what if". As a member of this team, you will design, develop, maintain and support our Enterprise Data Warehouse & BI platform using various data & BI tools based on the Google Cloud Platform. This position offers a unique opportunity to be a part of a team that creates and drives a data-driven culture across Borrego. We offer a hybrid work environment, allowing you to work remotely 2-3 days a week and from the office 2-3 days a week.At Borrego, we don’t accept the status quo. We are driven by a culture of teamwork, fearless thinking, safety, and adaptability as we pursue our mission to accelerate the adoption of renewable energy. With more than 850 MW already installed, we’re excited about the “Gigawatt Revolution” and growth happening across our company as we shift from megawatts to gigawatts of large-scale solar and energy storage in the coming years.After 40 years in business, Borrego is a trusted name in the solar industry and well-known for our strong employee culture. We combine the stability and wisdom gained by decades in business with an entrepreneurial spirit. Our employees are driven and animated by the Borrego System of Excellence, an operating framework detailing our mission, vision, strategy, and cultural principles and working systems.*About the Role*We are looking for a savvy Sr Data Analyst to join us as we build an analytics platform that will allow our businesses to answer "what", "when" and "how" as well as "what if". As a member of this team, you will design, develop, maintain and support our Enterprise Data Warehouse & BI platform using various data & BI tools based on the Google Cloud platform. This position offers a unique opportunity to be a part of a team that creates and drives a data-driven culture across Borrego.*Position responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following: *Using data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns to solve the most impactful business problems and unlock new opportunities for insight-driven value creationUsing tools and techniques to visualize data in easy-to-understand formatsPreparing reports and presenting these to management or stakeholdersMonitoring data quality and removing corrupt dataOrganizing and transforming information into Borrego’s semantic modelCollaborating with account managers, project developers, engineers, and organizational leaders to identify opportunities to improve on data origination from business process, recommend system modifications, and develop policies for data governanceCommunicating with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirementsDesigning and maintaining data systems and databases; this includes fixing coding errors and other data-related problemsCreating appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the steps of the data analysis process and duplicate or replicate the analysis if necessaryUsing statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts*Desired Skills and Experience*While no one individual will possess them all, the successful candidate will bring many of the following experiences, skills, and attributes:We are looking for a candidate with 4+ years of experience in a Data Analyst role, who has attained a Graduate or Equivalent degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative fieldAt Least 3+ yrs of working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databasesAt Least 3+ years experience with Tableau / Looker / PowerBIAbility to break large projects into smaller pieces to meet deadlines and ability to convert ideas into testable hypotheses and/or next stepsDemonstrated experience with data projects that combine business acumen and technical expertise to put data at the center of decisionsStrong sense of intellectual curiosity balanced with humility, drive, and teamworkExperience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environmentAbility to take ownership of deliverables, and build trust with stakeholdersExcellent organizational skills and attention to detailBuild data catalog, data dictionary and make data searchable for our stakeholders and usersExperience building and optimizing google BigQuery data pipelines, architectures, and data sets.Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets and big query expertise.Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management.*The following skills and experience are helpful (but not required)*Knowledge of proper A/B testing practices and statistical experiment designComfort with programming in Python and/or RWorking experience with SalesforceExperience with ERP systems such as Netsuite, Microsoft Dynamics or Oracle FinancialsExperience on an Agile Scrum project delivered under Continuous Delivery*Compensation, Benefits, and Culture*Borrego uses an internally equitable and externally competitive total cash approach to compensation. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, health, life, and disability insurance; a comprehensive wellness program; 401(k) plan with company match and immediate vesting; continuing education and professional development assistance; and self-managed flexible work schedules and time-off policies.Our corporate culture fosters collaboration, a growth mindset, and the ability to take risks — and we value innovative thinkers who will help us reach our ambitious growth goals. We believe that flexibility and work-life balance are important parts of long-term employee happiness and productivity. Our employees are trusted to get their work done and are given the freedom to do so when they are their most efficient, creative, and engaged.*Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion*Borrego values the diverse perspectives, skills, experiences, and contributions of all employees. We want all our employees to feel like they belong and are empowered to be their most authentic selves at work. We’re actively committed to fostering diversity and creating an inclusive environment not only within our own organization but also within the renewable energy industry.We seek a diverse candidate pool in this – and every – search. Borrego provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, disability, genetics, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by state, federal and local laws. In addition to federal law requirements, Borrego complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. EEO M/F/D/V.*A Note to Third-Party Recruiters*Borrego's People + Culture team coordinates all recruiting and hiring at our company. Borrego does not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters, staffing firms, or related agencies. Resumes are only accepted from third-party recruiters, staffing firms, or related agencies if a signed agreement is in place AND if external recruiting assistance is authorized by the People + Culture team for a specific position. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Borrego. Borrego is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.Job Type: Full-time

Have an engineering background? Use it to directly and ethically impact the experience of thousands of patients every day and around the world! We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer with creative ideas in artificial intelligence, visual analysis, data storage, security and the production experience to prove it.
What You'll Do
You will work on a variety of innovative and meaningful projects, from developing vision machine learning algorithms for applications such as patient monitoring, to building a training infrastructure for the core machine learning platform. Your solutions will make a significant impact in patients' healing experience and how the caretakers monitor patient well-being.
Who You Are
You’re creative. You’re organized. You’re experienced. You’ve done this before. You want to do it again. We’re not looking for a superhero who thinks sheer hours = good work. Excess doesn’t impress us – creativity and efficiency do. You’ll have 8 hours a day to work, and, we hope, at least 8 hours a night to sleep.
You are a passionate software engineer with a deep understanding of what makes live, highly scalable platforms. You care deeply about bringing your unique engineering mind into creating a considerate and sustainable team and product.
You are autonomous - a manager of one. You enjoy working alone, you can make your own decisions and you will take full ownership of your work, assuming the responsibility for every detail, every step of the way.
You are a solid writer. You document your every decision so you don't just save the day, but make the lives of your future teammates easier.
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications
BA/BS degree in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of work experience or equivalent production-level experience with developing Machine Learning pipelines.
Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: C/C++ or Python.
Experience with visual recognition, classification, insight generation and similar.
We are at the cutting edge of deep learning applications. The ideal candidate has a strong understanding of the under the hood fundamentals of deep learning (layer details, backpropagation, etc). Additional requirements include the ability to read and implement related academic literature and experience in applying state of the art deep learning models to computer vision (e.g. segmentation, detection)
Experience with PyTorch, or at least another major deep learning framework such as TensorFlow, MXNet.
Preferred Qualifications
MS or PhD degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, or related technical field.
Benefits
We work remotely and asynchronously, and that is why we are looking for a manager of one. But you will need to overlap for a few hours with San Francisco time in your normal work-day routine - this may mean a few hours of meetings in the evening depending on your time zone - we do our best to keep them short. We can provide you with space outside of your home to work if you need to (e.g. co-working offices), or help get your home to be more accommodating to work.
We do not trap people in front of their screens or lock them in overtime. Just the opposite. We’re all about reasonable working hours and ample vacation time. See our employee handbook here.
How To Apply
We want to get a sense of how you think and work. To that end, please be prepared to share with us your take on the following:
Tell us what you know about machine learning. How would you begin to approach figuring out where we stand with our technology, and where we should be standing?
Chart us an example of a machine learning pipeline that can support the needs of modern applications (related to detecting a person's activity)
What technologies inspired you recently? What machine learning technologies are you the most excited about?
We strongly encourage candidates of all different backgrounds and identities to apply. Each new hire is an opportunity for us to bring in a different perspective, and we are always eager to further diversify our company. Ouva is committed to building an inclusive, supportive place for you to do the best and most rewarding work of your career.
We value great writers, so take your time with the application and put thought into your cover letter if you are writing one, but keep it fewer than 1500 words. Tell us why you want this job, not just any job.
We can’t wait to hear from you!

To apply for this position, please send your resume, supplemental materials and letter to hello@ouva.co

JobTitle: newPrincipal Product Manager - Frontend Infrastructure SF or Re...
Content_text:
THE CHALLENGE

Are you excited about leveraging technology to bring the world together through live experiences? Would you be proud to build tools to help anyone and everyone create, share, find, and attend events that fuel their passions and enrich their lives?
Over the last decade, we have built a world-class software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform for event organizers, enabling millions of events globally. In the process, we have touched millions of consumers, helping them get together, explore their interests, and pursue their passions through live experiences.
In 2020, in the face of a global pandemic, our self-service ticketing and experience technology platform helped more than 650,000 creators issue over 230 million free and paid tickets to approximately 4.6 million events in nearly 180 countries. As we look forward to a resurgence of in-person events, we are looking for a highly skilled, experienced technical product manager who can deliver the product perspective to our Frontend Strategy.
THE ROLE
Eventbrite is looking for a Product Manager to help lead the charge as we continue strengthening our web app infrastructure and architecture. In this role, developers are your customer, however everything we do is in service of end-users. The tools and services we provide allow them to focus on building and shipping the unique value to end-users without having to worry about the infrastructure it relies on.
In this role, you will be responsible for the developer experience. You will own all stages of the Software Development Lifecycle. You will empower teams to autonomously own their products while minimizing toil. The Product Manager for this team will work closely with developers, Site Reliability Engineers, and constantly engage with your customers.
YOU WILL

Ground your work in product thinking by:
Championing a product-led approach to frontend software development, hosting, scaling, always advocating for the customer and collaborating widely to deliver the best outcomes for all stakeholders.
Establishing a comprehensive and detail-oriented understanding of the needs of your customers and stakeholders.
Building the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for the frontend web development platform.
Drive progress strategically and tactically by:
Managing the full strategic life cycle of your portfolio of products: lead the ideation, roadmapping, technical development, launch, and continuous improvement of innovative and sustaining platform products.
Managing tactical execution: partner with internal customer teams to define business requirements, gather and prioritize functional requirements, define use cases and craft product specifications, and govern the product backlog.
Support the team by:
Clearly communicating vision, strategy, roadmaps, and progress to a variety of internal customers and stakeholders, including product teams, technical collaborators, and senior leadership.
Defining and implementing best practices of the frontend web development platform.
THE SKILL SET
Technical prowess. You will take requirements docs to the finish line, and partner with engineers to finalize them. You speak tech lingo, you can research tooling and know how to evaluate the pros and cons of various approaches, and distill goals and requirements down in a way to align them with both technical complexity and technical goals.
You understand modern frontend web development technologies and tools, and can communicate these use-cases effectively to partners on different teams and with different levels of technical expertise.
You not only espouse “This is what product needs to be delivered", but connect it to the greater technical vision: "This is the idea behind the product, and here is how it relates to our current technical strategy".
You help guide the team objectively through challenging, important technical decisions. In a world surrounded by technical experts, you’re able to drive consensus and shared understanding. You embrace that the best decision may not always be the popular one, and help ensure everyone understands and commits to the outcome.
You are able to break down technically complex challenges to help teams build compelling products that affect multiple areas of ownership. You are able to connect and communicate the vision between the executive level to an engineering level.
Essential ways of working:
Ability to take initiative, work independently, and deliver results.
Extreme attention to detail and ability to self-audit work.
Excellent analytical skillsExcellent communication skills, both written and oral, including the ability to convey complex requirements in a clear, concise and credible manner
Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills
Interest in building tools for developers.
Technical PM knowledge and experience: Experience creating functional and technical specifications is a bonus. Experience as a software engineer is necessary. You need to be able to hold your own in the behind-the-scenes technical topics, and translate that into something approachable. A great opportunity for a product-minded engineer to break into the role.
5+ years as a product manager working on data-driven products or platforms
BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent knowledge and experience
Experience working with a very technical team on developer-facing products
BONUS POINTS
Experience with Frontend web app hosting tools such as Netlify, Vercel, AWS Amplify, Heroku
Experience working with Agile and Scrum methodologies
Technical Experience or strong knowledge in Frontend web app development, specifically React
Familiarity with web performance, accessibility and browser compatibility concerns
Former engineers with hands-on experience implementing frontend web apps
Familiarity at managing infrastructure and hosting, CDNs
Familiarity with monorepos, microservice architectures, and associated infrastructure
Experience rolling out platform wide changes
WHAT WE OFFER
At Eventbrite, we strive to support our Britelings and their loved ones through different stages of life with robust and attractive benefits, financial and physical wellness options, and great perks.
In addition to offering a competitive salary and company stock, we have other great benefits available. In the Briteland, you’ll find great medical plans, fertility and adoption benefits, wellness reimbursement, generous parental leave, on-site services, and much more.
We care about your mental health and wellbeing
Our employees enjoy free coaching sessions with Modern Health. We also offer free therapy sessions with a psychologist. You’ll also have access to private medical insurance for you and your family, that includes dental care. And if you like sports, we have our wellness program to pay for your gym expenses.
Ongoing training and career development is an important part of our culture
We offer unlimited access to courses in Udemy, language exchange programs, internal training, Briteling talks, workshops and weekly sessions with our CEO
Work-life balance is extremely important to us
Our employees can choose what works best for them: work in one of our offices, be fully remote or the best of both worlds! We believe in a flexible working environment to allow Britelings to perform at their best ensuring a healthy work-life balance. We have recently implemented Britebreak Fridays: all Britelings turn off their computers and take the first Friday of every month off to focus on their wellbeing.
ABOUT EVENTBRITE
Eventbrite is a global self-service ticketing and experience technology platform that serves a community of nearly one million event creators in over 180 countries. Since inception, Eventbrite has been at the center of the experience economy, transforming the way people organize and attend events. The Eventbrite platform provides an intuitive, secure, and reliable service that enables creators to plan and execute their live and online events, whether it's an annual culinary festival attracting thousands of foodies, a professional webinar, a weekly yoga workshop or a youth dance class. With over 300 million tickets distributed to more than 4 million experiences in 2019, Eventbrite is where people all over the world discover new things to do or new ways to do more of what they love.

IS THIS ROLE NOT AN EXACT FIT?
Sign up to keep in touch and we’ll let you know when we have new positions on our team.
Eventbrite is a proud equal opportunity/affirmative action employer supporting workforce diversity. We do not discriminate based upon race, ethnicity, ancestry, citizenship status, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, genetic information, military or veteran status, mental or physical disability, political affiliation, status as a victim of domestic violence, assault or stalking, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Every day, tens of millions of people from around the world come to Roblox to play, learn, work, and socialize in immersive digital experiences created by the community.

Our vision is to build a platform that enables shared experiences among billions of users. This is what's known as the metaverse: a persistent space where anyone can do just about anything they can imagine, from anywhere in the world and on any device. The breadth of opportunities, and the evolving demands of this first-of-its-kind platform, ensure that your avenues for growth are always expanding and flexible.

Join us and you'll usher in a new category of human interaction while solving exceptional challenges that you won't find anywhere else.
As a Network Production Engineer, you'll help us scale our global network infrastructure at a time of incredible growth for our business. At Roblox, you'll have boundless opportunities to shape the future of the Imagination Platform™ and demonstrate your passion for delivering thoughtful solutions in front of a global audience. If you know what it takes to develop large-scale network infrastructure that can sustain over five million concurrent players year-round and you take play as seriously as we do, you'll fit right into our highly experienced and ever-expanding engineering team.

You are:

Experienced: You have a BS degree (or equivalent professional experience) in Computer Science or related engineering field with 5+ years of experience supporting and managing a production network. You should also be familiar with PoP operations and deployment projects.
A network troubleshooting connoisseur: You come ready for action wielding a wealth of Layer 1, 2 and 3 networking expertise. You can assess and evaluate networking issues on Windows, Linux, Juniper, Arista, F5 and others. You understand BGP, IS-IS, MPLS, RSVP-TE, VRRP, MACsec. You should also be enjoy working with carriers and facilities to troubleshoot issues from layer-1 to layer-7.
An expert planner: you're always thinking two steps ahead; you have first-hand experience working with vendors to provide hardware and installation.
Familiar with basic automation skills to plan out any project

You will:

Develop the edge and backbone network infrastructure solutions to meet the large-scale and real-time requirements of our Imagination Platform™ to ensure our community has an thoughtful experience anywhere in the world.
Develop basic automation tools to eliminate repetitive tasks and improve reliability in any programming environment.
Identify problems, and prevent them from re-occurring through root cause analysis and automation.
Create, influence, and improve the development platform, infrastructure, standards, and methods to ensure the goal of scalability and high availability can be achieved.
Work with a creative team and collaborators that are distributed throughout the globe.
Participate in the on-call rotation for our infrastructure pieces around the globe.

You'll Love:

Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage
A rewarding 401k program
Flexible vacation policy
Free catered lunches five times a week and several fully stocked kitchens with unlimited snacks
Onsite fitness center and fitness program credit
Annual CalTrain Go Pass
A Roblox Admin badge for your avatar

PowWow Mobile helps enterprises transform their mission-critical software for mobile devices. If your calling is to GO FAST, BE LOUD, and BE DISRUPTIVE, we want you on our team as we COMMODITIZE this industry.

You will craft world-class solutions using game-changing mobile and cloud technology, and be empowered with the autonomy to make your mark. We are located in San Francisco’s SoMa district in the middle of the dynamic high-tech corridor.

We’re looking for smart, driven, committed and creative people who will give it their all. In exchange, we’ll give you competitive compensation, fantastic perks and benefits, and a piece of the action.

Description:

We are looking for a Sr. Web Consultant to join us at our company headquarters in San Francisco, CA. The successful candidate will assist the services team by providing technical expertise through pre-sales and post-sales engineering. Responsibilities include understanding customer architectural requirements, development, installation, and deployment of the SmartUX platform for demos, trials, pilots and production.

Your Day-To-Day:

Assist customers with designing and building mobile apps that will delight their users

Lead a team using PowWow’s powerful transformation platform to implement apps

Architect PowWow based solutions for a wide range of varying types of customers

Gather feedback from users, measure and improve the apps

Direct multiple concurrent projects and resources

Help build and enhance the PowWow’s best practices and methodologies

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

Strong Javascript programming background

Experience with front-end JavaScript frameworks like Cordova, jquery and angular.js

Experience with back-end JavaScript frameworks like node.js

Ability to quickly learn proprietary APIs and work with existing codebases

Ability to multi-task and manage multiple assignments in a fast-paced start-up environment

Great interpersonal and communications skills

8-10 years experience

Willingness to travel

Requires B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent

BONUS:

Web design skills

Strong knowledge of HTML5 and CSS

Experience implementing mobile apps

3-5 years of successful post-sales experience or equivalent

Experience participating with sales people and being part of the technical sales cycle

BENEFITS AND PERKS:

Highly competitive base compensation

Generous stock options

Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)

401k Plan

Catered team lunches every week from interesting local vendors

Open floor plan

Generous vacation policy

10 company paid holidays

Please submit your resume with cover letter to careers@powwowmobile.com

1+ years professional experience as QAE or similar role
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related technical field
Experience in Mobile App consumer facing feature manual testing on iOS and Android devices
Understanding of QA processes and concepts including test case preparation, and testing methodologies,
Experience creating, managing and implementing test plans.
Experience generating and communicating meaningful development metrics.
Strong attention to detail and problem solving skills.
Agile Testing Experience in an agile development environment (e.g. SCRUM/XP/Kanban) with experience writing acceptance criteria for user stories.

Amazon Mobile Shopping is one of the fastest growing strategic businesses within Amazon. Our scale is billions of dollars and millions of users. Our team is responsible for creating the best shopping experience for customers using their favorite mobile phones. Our mission is to elevate and simplify usability of the Amazon shopping app, with the vision to significantly modernize the app, keeping Amazon engaging and fresh. We push both evolutionary and revolutionary user experience (UX) experiments at a velocity to ensure customers feel the Amazon app as not only functional, but also delightful and on the cutting edge.

As a QA Engineer on the App Experiences team, you’ll have huge impact on how customers, even friends and family, interact with Amazon. Our App needs to meet remarkably high standards of quality, fluidity, performance and reliability. If you are enthusiastic about delivering quality user experience to delight customers, this is the right team for you.

At this role, you will test Mobile App features at the user level, both manually and with automated tools. You are responsible for driving our software development process towards quality-centric methodologies. You’ll setup QA processes to pace up our ability to deliver new feature to our customers. You will represent the Amazon shoppers perspective while development and you will have the opportunity to influence the user experience of Amazon Shopping App on Mobile devices. You use black box, gray box, and white box testing techniques. You understand software internals, debug problems using log files, and contribute to automated tests. You will work side by side with Product Managers, UX Designers, Mobile Engineers and are at the forefront of customer innovation. You will never be bored here!

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Create and maintain test cases, and update to cover new features.
Perform manual validation across iOS and Android devices.
Validate feature changes and perform targeted regression tests against Mobile App releases.
Track test projects and maintain reporting to partners throughout development cycle.
Work closely with development and business teams to communicate impacts and to understand business requirements
Be the ‘voice of the customer’ and push for quality in every phase of the development process.
Identify, document and track bugs through resolution.
Contribute to automated test coverage for critical functional areas under test
Vet automation reports, investigate failures and fix any false positives.
Perform root cause analysis investigation and troubleshoot errant product behavior.
Firm understanding of software development principles, capabilities and limitations of mobile platforms (iOS and Android).
Familiar software engineering (process, architecture, algorithms, data structures) and knowledge of Agile methodologies is a bonus.
Passion for mobile development. We would love to hear about Apps you’ve developed!
Willing to go the extra mile to do things right and fast
Strong organizational skills, tracking multiple test executions simultaneously and are able to synthesize the results.
Shows creativity and initiative to improve product test coverage and effectiveness.
Comfortable communicating cross-functionally and across management levels in formal and informal settings
Location could be either: San Francisco, CA or Cupertino, CA

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
